Find a friend to help you out and use teamwork to get the job done
Carry out exciting animal rescues in 4 different arenas
Requires an EyeToy USB Camera (for PlayStation 2)

Source: The Publisher Website.

122591.name: American Football Pursual
122591.description:
British version of an American Football related game.

The game is in two stages. First you have to get round a track (like Game of Goose games) until you get to the centre of the board. On the track you will get various things happen to you, it is just a game of chance.

Once you reach the centre, it becomes an American Football trivia game.

The winner is the first to score a touchdown by asking questions correctly and advancing to the end-zone.

122592.name: The Hustle: Detroit Streets
122592.description:
User Summary

The Hustle: Detroit Streets is a pool game where the player takes on the role of Kat Hudson or Jack Stone. They play their way through the clubs and pool halls of Detroit.

122593.name: Lelulaatikko
122593.description:
User Summary

Computer game amed for 9m-2y old kids. Featuring John and Siiri mouse. In the game you can help them find a magic toy box. The box is full of intriguing objects that Siiri can play with.
The game includs songs, rhymes and lots of other development and stimulating activities for your child. It is (supposed) to train
+ Exercises
+ Early vocabulary
+ Sound Identification
+ Identification
+ Discovery of similarities
+ guessing
+ Connection and effect patterns
Also: Many prints: drawings, lyrics, playing tips

122594.name: Kalle Kunskap Förskolan
122594.description:
When Donald Knowledge and Leo the Lion is out and fly into space with his Dream Ship, the unexpected visit of Tindra from Star Land. She says that PiRåttorna has plunged with his pirate ship in the Brilliant mountain, the place where all the stars come from. Now the stars trapped in the rock and can not light up the sky anymore.

Now, Charlie and Leo need your help! Find 5 pieces of yellow diamonds, remove PiRåttornas ship and free the stars, so they can fly up to heaven again!

The game is designed for children aged 3-5 years.

Exercises

Simple math
Subtraction
Addition
Organize
Sort
colors
Form
Poblem solving
Letters
Correlation and effect
The game also features three difficulty levels so that children can develop at their own pace.

Source: The Publisher Website.

122595.name: Cravache d'or
122595.description:
Players can buy racehorses sold at auctions and also bet horses if the race begins.

Money is won by good bets or by owning the winning horses.

For racing each horse moving is determined by rolling two dice.

Players with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

122596.name: Des lettres et des mots
122596.description:
Object of the game is to earn maximum points by getting rid of his letters. To do this, form new words from words already installed.

Each player draws a number of letters: 12 letters each with 2 players, nine letters of 2 to 4 players.
Based on number of players, each laying one or two 3-letter words on the board. These are the starting points they placed horizontally: 2 bases each with 2 players and one each in base 3 and 4 players.

In his turn player must add one of his letters to one of the words posed by changing it to form a new word and the player gets the points corresponding to the number of letters in the word and receives these points in chips.
- If the player can't reconstruct any word, it can exchange a letter from his game with a letter from the deck. In this case, it passes.
The game ends when a player places his last letter.
The player with the most points in chips is the winner.

Some more game-variants included.

122597.name: Unit 13
122597.description:
PORTABLE WARFARE.

Jump into the action with Unit 13 for PlayStation Vita and conquer 45 tactical missions as you help take down global terror networks and prove your place in the military elite. With the precision of the Vita's dual analog sticks, unique touch interface, Wifi connectivity for fast action and 2-player co-op, and 3G compatibility for instant social updates and daily challenges, Unit 13 is the perfect on-the-go action shooter.

Key Features:

Immersive and intuitive shooter controls with dual analog sticks and front and rear touch pads.
Select from six unique military operatives and take on 45 missions, competing against friends and the world for high scores.
Play solo or cooperatively with a friend over Wifi.
Conquer unique daily challenges and compete for high scores.
Stay connected with 3G, Wifi and NEAR for rankings updates, mission unlocks and more.

Source: The Game Website.

122598.description:
A few viking warriors sit at a table in smoky long hall, talking and bragging about war axes, women and pillages. Beer flows freely, but not even the cellars of Byggvir, the God of Beer, could quench the thirst of Nordland's greatest warriors. Servants run for cover, knowing full well where all this is going. Suddenly an eerie silence fills the common room. On the table, only one full cup remains. Who will get the last drink? Not a single step back is allowed to the warrior who wishes to enter Valhalla. One single thought in everyone's mind: may Fenrir eat the sun, that beer will be mine! All vikings laugh at the thought of death, draw their war axes, joining the fight at the call of "OOOODIIIIIIIIIIN!"

In Beer & Vikings you are a fierce and thirsty viking warrior, willing to do anything to get the last cup of beer. The winner is the most drunk viking – in game terms, the player who has collected the most beer drink counters – at the end of the sudden death round.

Be wary, though, for drinking too much will dull your wits and mastery with the war axe. Each drink of beer prevents you from using one of your resources, be it a weapon, an item, or even your personal skill! You must always be wary not to drink too much or you risk becoming a defenseless sot in the hands of your enemies. On the other hand, you will be able to burn up some of the beer you have drunk to obtain significant bonuses which may well save your life. Show yourself as the wise warrior you are and balance your strategy with care, not burning up too much beer, thus finding yourself in the rear at the end of the game, when the cup is empty and the sudden death round begins. Those who will succumb to their enemies' blows won't be eliminated from the game, but will become Spirits of Loki, the thirsty god of evil, and team up with the other Spirits to attack the living, aiming to steal their beer. Raise your glasses (and your axes)!

Beer & Vikings introduces 112 brand new cards! including a new type of cards called "Valhalla" which provide you a strong ability during the match – but to obtain them you need to kill an opponent. Thus, to gain this power you must generate a vengeful spirit first. Be careful when you follow the Valhalla way...

Beer & Vikings, a board game for 3-8 players about war axes, blood and beer, is both a standalone game and an expansion for Sake & Samurai.

Integrates with


Sake & Samurai


Microbadge:
122598.name: Beer & Vikings

122599.description:
Following the victory in the Conflict of Autumn, The Regime of Winter has clutched the Land of Fairy Tales in its cold grasp. Fuelled by hate and fear, Winter aims at extinguishing the flame of Love and the light of Hope under a blanket of snow and the never-ending chill of a winter night. In the winding alleys and the small houses desperately clinging to the hillside of Wintertown, frightened Tales move in the shadows, knowing they cannot allow all Hope for the future to be snuffed out by the cold and ready to fight to drive Winter away and let Spring come again.

In Winter Tales, a storytelling board game, players tell the tale of the conflict between the characters of fairy tales, who represent all that is good and hopeful, and the Soldiers of Winter, who incarnate evil and the fierce cold of Winter. Players will ally themselves with one of the warring Factions, controlling characters and fighting for the comeback of Spring or the suffocation of all hope, bringing on an endless Winter.

Winter Tales is an ever-changing game as each time the players will tell a completely different story, creating a shared plot.
122599.name: Winter Tales

122600.name: Toners: Let Us Sing Into The Mouths Of One Another
122600.description:
Using a paper towel tube, two players position the tube so it covers each of their mouths.
On the third player's signal, the two players adjoined by a tube intone a tone. Their goal is to stop and start the tone as many times as possible before the get out of sync. If one of them stops the tone for longer than a second before the other stops, then their turn is over.
The non-intoning player is responsible for counting the number of stops and for judging when the turn should end. Players are awarded one point for each successful start and stop. Play rotates so that the non-intoning player becomes one of the two intoning players in a new round of play.
The player with the most points after a predetermined number of rounds wins.

122601.name: Gym Cerveau
122601.description:
Object of the game is to answer the questions and recognize the objects with Your senses: with Your hand, Your mouth, Your nose, Your ears and Your eyes to score points.
Gym in brain, you need to answer all your senses. You will need to reconstruct such a figure (Tangram-style) with a blindfold, to recognize a tree among several wafers fragrant, count the colors in a literary text, or find a taste on the tip of language.

Players who is the best to recognize and score most points is the winner,

122602.name: Daniela Katzenberger Party-Time
122602.description:
Objective: score winning points by achieving most accordance;
learn more about your teammates
- acting by turn -
draw a card and ask questions about life-style, fashion, love, partnership... (according to the coloured die roll) out of the world of 'Daniela Katzenberger'
the better you can judge the opinion of your teammates the more points you are going to score ==> judging questions like:
Who trusts somebody to do something?
Who is willing to do delicate things?

122603.description:
A module for Lambourne's "World of Motor Racing".

This statistical replay game recreates the Indy 500 race. It uses the same basic rules as the base game, but adds specific rules unique to the Indy 500 race, such as different starting grids, Yellow Lights Phases, start procedure and pit stops.

As in the basic game, everything you do is handled by a roll of two dice and different tables for each driver, car and track section. The outcome of this roll and a number of modifiers tell you how many spaces you are allowed to move.
122603.name: World of Motor Racing: Indy 500

122604.description:
A module for Lambourne's "World of Motor Racing".

This statistical replay game recreates the British Touring Car Championship. It uses the same basic rules as the base game, but adds specific rules unique to touring car races.

As in the basic game, everything you do is handled by a roll of two dice and different tables for each driver, car and track section. The outcome of this roll and a number of modifiers tell you how many spaces you are allowed to move.
122604.name: World of Motor Racing: The British Touring Car Championship

122605.name: Din's Curse: Demon War
122605.description:
Din's Curse: Demon War is the first expansion for the unique action RPG Din's Curse. Din's Curse is a single player and co-op multiplayer action RPG for Windows and Mac PCs with 141 class combinations (196 with the expansion), infinite number of dynamically generated towns, real consequences, and a dynamic, evolving world.

The demons of Aleria are furious! After the 4th Great War and necromancer Ciglio's death, the undead horde has been causing utter chaos, attacking everything that moves... even demons. Demonkind were quite happy when Serina, a human city, was overrun, but that was before thousands of human zombies poured into Kraval, slaughtering the huge demon city. Thus began the Demon War. Demons of all kinds are fighting back. They're hunting down and killing any undead they find. Oh, and they blame the humans for this entire mess. For spite, they razed Serina to the ground even though it was already deserted.

As a servant of the mighty Din, it's your responsibility to safeguard humans from danger. This was a hard task before. Do you have what it takes to save humankind from the Demon War?

Source: The Publisher Website.

122607.name: The Rolling Dead
122607.description:
A competitive or cooperative, dice rolling, Zombie survival experience.
In the game, each player rolls dice to acquire different resources. These resources are used to build and maintain a group of survivors who are working to eliminate the Zombie horde while trying to survive. Each roll of the dice presents difficult choices as players must decide which of these valuable resources they will keep, spend, or chance in order to best equip their survivors!

As the game begins players take turns rolling dice. Players must work to feed their survivors, buy items such as weapons, or special skills that allow players to manipulate their dice rolls to best benefit their survivors. Players will work their way through Town, battling Zombies and gaining Victory Points for each Zombie eliminated and each survivor that remains alive. But players must beware of opponents who can draw Zombies to their location as they try to move in and steal Victory Points and other valuable rewards that are specific to each location in Town. The pace is frantic, the Zombies are hungry and survivors can easily turn on one another!

Can you survive?

122608.name: L'Odyssée
122608.description:
A little game of chance about the adventures of Odysseus on his return to Greece.

In his turn player roll the dice, moves his counter and if it stands on one of the events, inspired by the adventures of Odysseus during his Odyssey, must act accordingly.

The first arrived at the destination wins.

122609.name: Treasure Defense
122609.description:
User Summary

Treasure Defense is a Tower defense game, you have to defend your crystals from power hungry demons.

Features:

- 3 different kind of turrets.
- 7 upgrade levels for each tower.
- 10 Kinds of demons.
- 15 maps.

122610.name: Trial Xtreme 2
122610.description:
"It is an interactive game that invites you to join the engrossing motorcycle race. Ride your motorbike and surmount the track obstacles using the touch screen and phone accelerometer. Slake your thirst for speed with 60 levels of breathtaking motorcycle adventures. Develop your biking skills: jump, climb, flip! Try to achieve the quickest time possible on each level – thus you can become the world champion. PLAY, HAZARD, WIN!"

Source: The Developer Website.

122611.name: Vizati
122611.description:
"Julie and Ben have discovered a strange and magical cube. Together and with the help of other friends they try to discover it’s mysteries.

Vizati is a puzzle game in which you need to connect the little vizati stones by color. There’s 2 different modes of playing it. One of them is story mode where the stone Vizati is discovered by Julie and Ben and they try to find out what it is and uncover it’s secrets. The other one, Arcade mode is a more traditional way to play it."

Source: The Developer Website.

122612.name: Slumbering Tsar: The Hidden Citadel, Part 6: Caverns of the Barrier
122612.description:
From the publisher's website:

Finally the veil of secrecy is lifted and the player characters fully understand the threat that the Hidden Citadel represents and what has truly been slumbering in ruined Tsar. In a race against time, the PCs pit themselves against a 10,000-year-old legacy and the vow of mighty Orcus to make the world his own in this, the climactic conclusion of The Slumbering Tsar Saga. PCs should be 20th level and above by the time they have completed this adventure.

122613.description:
Creekos: The Card Game is a trick-taking card game with a customized deck that pits two partnerships of two players against one another, first in an auction to determine the power of their cards, then in the card play itself.

At the start of the game two auctions take place, one for the number scale – that is, which value on the cards they hold will be used by the partnership – and a second for the trump color. After this, the players then compete in a trick-taking game that uses customized cards in different categories that relate to one another; in the packet "Hercules' Labors", for example, the categories are Events, Gods, People, Creatures, Lifeless. For each trick, players lay one card in the center of the table – with some cards having special abilities that activate thunderbolts or block other cards – and the most powerful card wins the trick. Once all the tricks are finished, players tally their points (subtracting however many points they bid at the start of the game), and the partnership with the high score wins.

Creekos: The Card Game can also be played by only two players, with each player competing on her own.
122613.name: Creekos: The Card Game

122614.name: Alteration
122614.description:
Alteration is a post apocalyptic card game set in a science fantasy futuristic world that has been destroyed by the cataclysm known as The Great War. In Alteration players take on the roles of mutants, plants, animals, and even pure strain humans in a struggle to claim powerful technology left from before the great war! players take turns acquiring new mutations and researching technology to defeat the opponents.

In Alteration each player receives a random character card that they will use to get their stats, hit points, and special abilities. Each turn players will chose different actions to get more mutation cards, try to research technology, Attack an opponent, or use a power on one of there cards. many of these actions use dice to determine if the attack or power hits or if you can repair the tech you are trying to use and gain its card for use next turn. play continues until only one player has hit points left. The last mutant standing is the winner!

Do you have what it takes to traverse the irradiated wastes of Alteration?

122616.name: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying: A Game of Thrones Edition

rpg.701: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying

122616.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Game of Thrones Edition is the new core rulebook for A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying. Based on George R.R. Martin's fantasy epic, A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying gives you everything you need to play and run games in the Seven Kingdoms using an easy to learn system specifically designed to evoke the atmosphere of the best-selling novels and hit TV show. This edition includes the entire contents of the original rulebook, revised and updated, plus the full length adventure Peril at King's Landing and a gorgeous new cover by fan favorite Michael Komarck. You and your fellow players take on the roles of key members of a noble house navigating the perilous waters of Westerosi politics and intrigue. Now is your chance to play the Game of Thrones with Green Ronin's A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying!

122617.name: Le Goûter de Winnie
122617.description:
Object of the game is to be ​​the first to go home with the full pie, the party favors, sandwiches, drinks and masks.

Setup: The players put up their houses on the corner of the game and choos the characters.
In his turn player spins the wheel. Either the arrow indicates a number to advance his charakter to field with something he doesn't have (party favors, sandwich, drink, masks) and he takes it.
If the arrow indicates "pie" in which case the player chooses a pie face down and shows it to everyone. if the share belongs to his pie he keeps it.

When a player has all the elements of pie he returns to home. First player to reach his house is the winner

122618.name: Tunnels of Doom
122618.description:
From Wikipedia: Tunnels of Doom is a video game programmed by Kevin Kenney in 1982 for the TI-99/4A computer system. Tunnels of Doom is consistently listed by TI-99/4A fans as one of the top games available for the system.

The game is one of the first graphical role-playing video games . Based loosely on the tabletop role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons, it is a standard dungeon crawl adventure in which a player or number of players controls the fates of 1–4 characters as they journey into the depths of the Tunnels of Doom. Despite the lack of a progressive storyline, it possesses many elements duplicated by other, later CRPGs.

The music for Tunnels of Doom was composed by Hank Mishkoff, a TI programmer who also wrote the music for the TI-99/4 Demonstration program and other early TI-99/4 programs. Mishkoff originally created the music for The Attack, an earlier program; however, TI rejected the composition for that game, using it with Tunnels of Doom instead.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tunnels of Doom," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122619.name: A More Perfect Union: The Struggle to Ratify the Constitution
122619.description:
This 2-player game simulates the great public debate over the ratification of the Constitution that took place across the United States from 1787-1789. The game employs the popular card-driven mechanics of such well-known games as Twilight Struggle and 1960: The Making of the President. Representing the Federalists and Anti-Federalists, the players pursue strategies to ratify or defeat the Constitution. The Federalists win if nine states ratifiy the Constitution. The Anti-Federalists win if five states refuse to ratify.

The game places a premium on hand management and strategic planning by providing players with the tools to build powerful hands of cards over consecutive turns. After players become familiar with the deck of cards, playing time should be around 2 hours.

122620.name: The Eleven Kingdoms Poster Map
122620.description:
From the publisher's website:

This large poster (24" x 36" - 61cm x 91cm) comes rolled in a tube (no crease marks!).

The map is in full color, and covers the Eleven Kingdoms area of the Deryni world. Major cities, towns, religious establishments, and places of intereste are all marked, as are rivers and mountains and other geographical features.

Also included: an inset map of the city of Rhemuth (capital of the Kingdoms of Gwynedd), and a plan of St. George’s cathedral and the Archbishop’s Palace.

122621.name: Route 666
122621.description:
User Summary

Route 666 is a post-apocalyptic "road warrior" setting for Fudge that also uses a cutdown version of the Fudge rules, so that it can be used as a stand alone game. It was available as a free download for a time at tripod.com.

The designer credits a number of inspirations…

"The following persons, movies, comics and games were determinant for the creation of Route 666 as creative inspiration: Steffan O’Sullivan, for creating FUDGE, James Boldry, creator of Mutant Bikers of the Atomic Wastelands, James Wedig, creator of FUDGE: Full Throttle, the games Gamma World, Blood Dawn, Car Wars, GURPS Autoduel, GURPS Fallout, Bitume, the movies and movie series of Mad Max, 1997:Escape from N.Y., Tremors, Death Race 2000, Accion Mutante, the videogames Interstate ’76, Wastelands, Bad Blood, Carmageddon, the comics Tank Girl, Akira, Okuto no Ken, The City, Dominion, Rebel, White Trash, Joe Bar Team, Mirai Shonen Conan."

Route 666 comes with a rules that set covers character creation, bike creation, combat, equipment, etc., along with a character sheet and a bike sheet.

122622.name: Time Claw
122622.description:
From the Introduction

Time Claw is an unofficial adaption of the Ironclaw RPG mechanics for use for time travel adventures in the multi-verse of the BBC’s Doctor Who series of television shows, books, movies and audio recordings.

In it you play a character who has been swept up from your proper place in time and space and cast adrift aboard a TARDIS (Time and Relative Dimensions In Space) a vehicle which allows movement thru the temporal vortex which touches each and every location in the universe and every point in time at each of these points.

If you are unfamiliar with the Dr. Who series don’t worry too much about, most travelers in the game begin with no real knowledge or understanding of the nature of greater reality. Concentrate instead on your character and the rest will eventually fall into place. Game Managers (Game Host in Ironclaw terminology) will need a copy of the basic Ironclaw RPG book (published by Sanguine Productions Ltd., ISBN 0-97045583-0-4) to work with beyond the information contained in this booklet.

122624.name: Assault at the Ogre Camp
122624.description:
User Summary

Assault at the Ogre Camp is a free fan-created mini-module for the classic version of the DragonQuest RPG.

The module provides an Ogre encampment in an old mining camp and includes a full-color map. As the author states...

"This mini adventure contains ideas and structure for a GM to adjust and add their own encounter detail as necessary. It is not a complete adventure and is presented here as an idea generator for tailoring into an existing campaign."

122625.name: Magery
122625.description: 2 Player game with fantasy theme that combines chess with worker placement. Minions of 8 types are used as both chess pieces, some with unique moves, and also as workers. Each round players take turns placing their minions into the 16 available Tower Chambers. Each chamber holds a distinct Mage that grants a special power, such as adding a minion to the board or moving a specific type of minion on the board. Players then take turns removing their minions from the tower to activate these powers. 12 chaos mages are available to mix things up. Win by capturing your opponents greater minions or by wiping him off the board.

122626.name: Defenders of Ardania
122626.description:
Defender of Ardanias innovative new game concepts include light RTS elements, taking the popular genre to the next level. Players must oversee unit production and upgrades while assembling the most effective army from one of three playable races, each with unique locations, towers, and units. However, without magic, a fantasy game is little more than a toothless lion (or dragon, rather), so a wide range of spells will be available for players to decimate their enemies and protect their forces.

Although Defenders of Ardania includes a single-player portion, the focus of the game is undoubtedly multiplayer, where two to four players can take each other on or compete against AI opponents via Internet, LAN, or PSN. The multiplayer component offers three different game modes where players can assume either the defensive or offensive sides –or both!

• An intriguing new take on the massively popular tower defense genre: players lead both offensive and defensive operations
• Ardania: the world of Majesty with three playable races and their unique environments
• Defense: 24 different upgradeable towers to erect against the invading enemy
• Attack: 24 varied units with diverse attributes to assemble into an offensive force
• Strong multiplayer component with a variety of game modes for up to four players
• Interactive environment that affects gameplay
• A wide range of offensive and defensive spells

Source: The Game Website.

122627.name: Warp
122627.description:
WARP IS A PUZZLE-BASED STEALTH ACTION GAME WHERE YOU PLAY AS ZERO, A LOVEABLE-YET-LETHAL ORANGE ALIEN WITH A BIG SCORE TO SETTLE! CAPTURED BY THE VILLAINOUS COMMANDER AND IMPRISONED IN HIS UNDERWATER FACILITY, ZERO MUST PLAN HIS ULTIMATE ESCAPE USING HIS ARSENAL OF ALIEN ABILITIES - WARP, FRAG, ECHO, SWAP, AND LAUNCH.

Source: The Game Website.

122628.name: All Zombies Must Die!
122628.description:
All Zombies Must Die!, the spiritual successor to Burn Zombie Burn!, is an Arcade- RPG where killing as many zombies as possible is top of the to-do list. The fate of humanity – or at least the small town of Deadhill – rests in the hands of four unlikely heroes: Jack, the gamer; Rachel, the girl; Brian, the geek; and Luxo, the alien. Go it alone, or enlist the services of up to three like-minded chums to survive the zombie apocalypse.

INTENSE ZOMBIE-SLAYING ACTION!
Reload your shotgun, sharpen your sword and rev that chainsaw; the town is teeming with zombies, and it’s your job to put ‘em down! All Zombies Must Die! fuses many gameplay elements to create a frenetic RPG shooter with hilarious characters and a playful, self-referential narrative.

TWIN-STICK SHOOTING MEETS RPG!
Level up characters, complete side quests and collect items to craft new weapons. With a host of role-playing features, there’s no shortage of options in how you choose to dispose of the undead. Zombies come in varying shapes and sizes, and are affected by four environmental modifiers; fire, radiation, sonic and shock.

FOUR PLAYER CO-OP!
Surviving against a seemingly endless horde of zombies is always easier with a friend or two – or better yet: three. With four player local co-op, All Zombies Must Die! offers a frantic multiplayer experience that incites excitement on and off the screen.

Source: The Game Website.

122629.name: Mount and Blade Collection
122629.description:
Massive medieval battles, open sandbox worlds, three expansive campaigns.
What story will you tell?

Included within the Mount & Blade Collection are:

• Mount & Blade is soaked with the blood of sellswords. Survive, and turn a profit!
• Mount & Blade: Warband: Command your own faction and engage in 64 player multiplayer!
• Mount & Blade: With Fire and Sword: Firearms have come to Europe! Learn to tame their unholy roar.

FEATURES:
• Free-form sandbox gameplay.
• Be a merchant, a mercenary, a knight or a lord of the land.
• Go anywhere, do anything in a world thriving with hundreds of locations.
• Use one of the most intuitive medieval fighting systems ever devised.
• Multiplayer battles with up to 64 players.
• Multiplayer modes include Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Conquest, Battle and Siege.
• Includes Multiplayer mode: Captain. Up to 16 players can each command a squad of soldier
• Enhanced siege mechanics: storm the castle, blow up the wall, bribe an officer or poison the well/food to get past the defenses!

Source: The Game Website.

122631.name: Diamino compétition
122631.description:
Diamino Competition is a crossword game for up to 2-8 players, according to the rules of the game chosen.

The game includes 112 square, 110 carry a letter with a number indicating its point value. The last 2 squares representing a devil and can replace any letter. These devils have no point value.
The black boxes and the devils of different colors on the game board, create barriers or benefits.

1. The first player forms a word of eight letters long either horizontally or vertically with the first letter placed on the green box.
The player on the left continue and raises the number of squares they want to form, with the squares already in play, a new word.
2. The game should at all times, consist of complete words separated from each other. One or more voids must be present between two consecutive words
3. Exchanges. Each player may at any time redeem one or more squares of his hand, against an equal number of squares of the reserve. This exchange account for a ride. The square to the reserve (in reverse) are mixed again.
4. Benefits and barriers.
Black boxes found on the shelf boxes are prohibited. During the game, it is impossible to place a square.
Boxes with Diable Vert are in principle also prohibited. all-time, a player who needs to use them to form a word, may place a tile. In this case, as a penalty, he must take an extra tile to the reserve.

The winner is the player who succeeds in placing all his tiles first. The number of points acquired by him is the total of the numbers on squares that remain in the hands of other players.
If the winner ends the game by recovering a black box, the number of points is doubled.

122632.name: Fight On! (Issue 8 - Winter 2010)
122632.description:
From the publisher's website:

Surrounded on all sides by monstrous aliens, cruel demigods, and ancient lich-kings? Pull out your +4 Plasma Blaster and Fight On! Issue 8, dedicated to cover artist Erol Otus, is ready to ROCK YOUR GAME with new races, classes, spells, tables, gods, monsters, traps, reviews, a ‘desert sandbox’ minicampaign, two longer adventures, eight minidungeons, and lots of other goodies to help you take it to the next level – or stop the PCs from getting there! With art and articles by Erol Otus, Kevin Mayle, Mark Allen, Lee Barber, Peter Jensen, Steve Robertson, Samuel Kisko, Patrick Farley, Robert Lionheart, Ramsey Dow, Jeff Rients, Gabor Lux, Age of Fable, Baz Blatt, Zachary Houghton, Erin “Taichara” Bisson, Del L. Beaudry, Geoffrey O. Dale, Michael Curtis, Tavis Allison, James Maliszewski, Tony Dowler, and many, many more, this issue is jam-packed with the old-school action adventure you crave. Don’t miss out – grab it today!

122633.name: Multipuzzle
122633.description:
This is, at first glance, a puzzle but it was always intended to be a game when two want to play.

Inside are 48 plastic shapes and two trays. The puzzle element is that one set of these plastic shapes, 24 in all, must be placed into the tray in such a way that they all fit.

The game is why there are two trays and 48 pieces. Each player has a tray and 24 pieces and it is a race against time to complete the problem the fastest. That player wins.

The box promises that there are 48 puzzles to solve so that should keep a pair of solvers pleased.

rpgitemversion.160374: Base set of 80 cards plus promos

122634.name: Spiral of Tharizdun (Fortune Cards)
122634.description:
Publisher's blurb:
Encounter Fortune.

Dungeons & Dragons Fortune Cards, sold in booster packs of 8 cards, give players fun new ways to survive the challenges of the D&D Encounters in-store play program, as well as their home campaigns. These cards give characters fun, temporary benefits that feel different from the benefits gained from powers and feats, without adding undue complexity to the D&D game.

user comment
this is a base set of 80 cards plus promos

122635.name: Les Monsieur Madame le jeu
122635.description:
The object of the game is to be the first to get 20 points by taking on challenges and being the fastest to find characters on the game board

In his turn player spins the arrow and draws a card of the color indicated by the arrow.

Cards represent one of the characters. The first one who puts his finger on the image of this character (exactly the same image!) on the gameboard, wins the card. He places it face up in front of him.

Some cards are "clues": these represent either a close-up, or the silhouette of a character. The first one who puts his finger on the image of the character wins the card
Ps! The character on the image must be exactly the same position!

Some cards are "challenges": only the player who drawn this card challenges with all other players to score point or not. If the award is made, the player keeps the card.

The end of the game:
The first to get a total of 20 points wins. Points (1 to 3, depending on the difficulty) are indicated on each card.

122637.name: Last Samurai
122637.description:
Campaign level wargame for the Satsuma Rebellion(Seinan Sensou).
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satsuma_Rebellion
Designer's note said, "Last samurai" has been designed with reference to basic engine of Paths of Glory and deck building concept from Dominion.

Players control either imperial Japanese Army or Rebels of Satsuma Domain. Players manage military operation and resources represented by the card.

The winner is determined by the collapse of morale. Morale will be reduced by the difference of the holding number of important spaces. Satsuma Domain player will also win that morale will not collapse until the final turn.

122639.name: Das kleine Kölnquiz
122639.description:
Objective:
give correct answers on questions abouut Cologne -
- acting by turn -
A small trivia game about Cologne with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.
Questions like: Whats the name of a non-Cologne-citizen?
How long was Adenauer senior mayor?
What is a 'Bangendresser', what's a 'Pittermännchen*?

122640.name: 3 to 13
122640.description:
A traditional card game where the aim of the game is to score the minimum score possible over 11 rounds of play.

using 2 standard decks of cards shuffled together, each player is dealt a number of cards depending on the round, starting with 3 cards, then 4, 5, 6 etc until the players have 13 cards in hand for the final round.

Players attempt to "go out" by playing their cards out of their hand following the rules for each round, all other players add up the scores of their cards in hand in a running total. After 11 rounds, the player with the lowest score wins. As an extra, you can score individual points for who went out each round as a bonus competition.

Cards are scored based on their number, with face cards counting as 10 points, and aces as 25

Aces are wild cards, additionally, for each round, the card matching the number of cards in hand for that round (so, 3 in the first round, then 4, 5, 6 etc) is also wild (up to J, Q, K)

Jokers can be used additionally as wild cards, and also score 25 points if left in hand when someone goes out

On a player turn, they may draw a card from the face down draw pile, or lay any number of allowed hands to the table
When a player goes out, all other players have one final chance to play any cards from hand that they can before assessing the score of cards left in hand.

Players play their own melds to the table in front of them and can extend those in any combination as part of playing hands to the table (usually this is done as a final turn to shed cards in hand). E.g. in the round of 9 cards, if you'd earlier played a 3 of a kind and a run of 3, you could later on play another 3 of a kind to finish, OR you could for example put 1 card on the 3 of a kind to make it a 4 of a kind, and another 2 cards on the run to make it a 5 card run.

The rules for playing cards out of hand are as follows:

Round, Cards in hand to start, wild cards, allowed plays
1,3,A+3+(Joker), 3 of a kind (3K), or 3 card run flush (3R)
2,4,A+4+(Joker), 4K or 4R
3,5,A+5+(Joker), 5K or 5R
4,6,A+6+(Joker), 6K or 6R or mix of 3R, 3K
5,7,A+7+(Joker), 7K or 7R, or a mix of 3R,3K,4R,4K
6,8,A+8+(Joker), 8K or 8R, or a mix of 3,4,5 card run or set
7,9,A+9+(Joker), 9K or 9R, or a mix of 3,4,5,6 card run or set
8,10,A+10+(Joker), 10K or 10R, or mix of 3,4,5,6,7 card hands
9,11,A+J+(Joker), 11K or 11R, or mix of 3,4,5,6,7,8 card hands
10,12,A+Q+(Joker), 10K or 10R, or mix of 3,4,5,6,7,9 card hands
11,13,A+K+(Joker), 10K or 10R, or mix of 3,4,5,6,7,8,9,10 card hands

122641.name: Welt der Hansestadt Hamburg das Quiz
122641.description:
Objective: score most winning points knowing correct answers about Hamburg.

With this quiz game the players will learn (with 220 questions) some detailed information about the city of Hamburg. From the box: 'With this game another lifestyle trend arrives now in the world of board games'.
2 different playing versions:
Version 1: active player draws a card and reads the question & 4 possible answers (of which 1, 2 or 3 may be right); now each player may invest gradually chips to be placed betting on different answers; correct answer(s) is(are) printed on the back of the card;
Version 2: find out the proper sequence of three answers regarding posted question

122642.name: Das kleine DDR-Quiz
122642.description:
Objective: Know correct answers on questions out of the former GDR
- acting by turn -
A small trivia game about GDR; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.
Questions like: What is a 'Gummifuffziger'? How many disticts did GDR possess?

122643.name: Imperial Gazetteer (Pathfinder)
122643.description:
From the back of the book:

WHERE THE LIVING LIVE IN FEAR
The Imperial Gazetteer

Who can withstand the undead princes of Morgau and Doresh? The vampires and spectral knights long ago claimed the country of Morgau & Doresh as their own, leaving the ghouls their empire deep beneath the earth. Both are fully detailed here.

The Imperial Gazetteer takes you deep within the palatial crypts of the realms where death fears to dread, giving Pathfinder Roleplaying Game roleplayers:
• A history of the undead nations above and below the earth.
• A giant cast of undying antagonists and allies.
• A new race that allows players to experience the life of the living dead.
• The underground capital of the Emperor of the Ghouls.
• Undead-themed gods and magical items.
• A bestiary containing more undead than you can shake a stake at.

122644.name: Anstarra Rules of Play
122644.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anstarra has 8 basic rules you must know. For easy memorization, each one coincides with a letter in the word A-N-S-T-A-R-R-A.

1. Always play safe
2. Never stop playing (except for safety)
3. Spells and special effects use cards
4. Treasure is kept in pouches
5. All solid unblocked weapon hits are wounds
6. Receiving a limb wound disables that limb
7. Receiving a torso wound knocks you out
8. After dying, you become a spirit

122645.name: Das kleine Allgemeinwissensquiz
122645.description:
Objective: know most of very generic questions

A small trivia game about knowlegde; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 nswers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.
Questions like:
Speed of light? When did the basic law of Germany become valid?

122646.description:
This is a promotional edition of the classic trivia game Trivial Pursuit, published by an Austrian newspaper to celebrate its hundredth birthday.

The game contains 250 trivia cards with 6 questions each from the following categories:
Blue: Politics
Pink: Foreign Countries
Yellow: Local News
Brown: Local Scene
Green: Sports
Orange: Editorial Department (specific questions about the newspaper)

Every player (or team) gets a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes (standard Trivial Pursuit issue). There is no game board. A special six-sided die showing the six colors mentioned above is rolled by the player on turn. The color tells from which category the question comes.

If the player on turn can answer the question, he gets another turn and, if he does not has it already, the corresponding colored pie piece which he puts in his playing piece. If he answers wrong, it's the next player's turn.

The first player to collect all colors wins the game.

The set is fully compatible with every other Trivial Pursuit game.
122646.name: Trivial Pursuit: Kronen Zeitung 1900 – 2000

122647.name: The Cube
122647.description: Challenge your family to games based on the hit ITV gameshow The Cube . The show's nail-biting format has been cleverly downsized for this fun family game that retains all the best elements of the series. There are seven rounds of physical and electronic challenges to complete and players have just nine lives to use up before being booted out of the game. There are options to do a Trial Run or Simplify the challenges, just like in the show, and with 50 different games included, The Cube Game is sure to keep the whole family entertained. Designed for two to six players aged eight and up, the The Cube Game is great for fans of the TV show but just as fun for those who are new to the format. Features: Family game based on the ITV gameshow Complete seven rounds of games to win 50 different games to complete Use your nine lives, Trial Run and Simplify tokens For 2 to 6 players, aged 8 and up

122648.name: Journey Home
122648.description:
A discussion-based, roll and move board game,with an optional role-playing element. It can be played competitively or with elements of co-operation. Each player starts at home, is born in a different position in life, has certain life-long qualities, and is faced with certain events and choices. The aim is to go home, and the game ends when one or more players have completed the journey and acquired the necessary number of tokens.The game is different each time it is played - depending on the players and the life events that crop up.

There are two journeys:

•Through age: by moving through the quadrants of the board representing childhood, youth, prime and vintage, each with a gateway into the next.
•Towards home: by accumulating tokens of particular colours, representing the different strands of home: shelter, family, community, environment and inner peace.

When one player goes home, s/he is able to help others do so with any extra tokens. At the end of the game, each player may tell the story of his/her character.

The game is based on the book of the same name (formerly The O of Home) by Jennifer Kavanagh. A significant percentage of the profits will be going to a national charity for homeless people.

All materials from sustainable sources, or recyclable.

122649.description:
An expansion for the Trivial Pursuit Family Edition game.

The box contains 200 yellow cards with easy questions and 200 blue cards with harder questions.
122649.name: Trivial Pursuit: Familien Kartensatz

122650.name: Gear Jammers
122650.description:
You're about to embark on the greatest adventure of your life. You will have the chance to become one of six of the most unbelievable characters you will ever meet. You become the owner of a highly technical fleet of trucks, with a dealer network worldwide. Now you will find out if you have what it takes to be a real..."Gear Jammer". A gear jammer is a trucker/owner that is prepared to take the chance....challenge and risk to become the most successful on the board game of...Gear Jammers!

Objective: To see who can run the most successful trucking business...based on a combination of companies owned, trucks on the road and cash on hand. To do this, you will want to buy all the trucks you can buy, invest in companies that are going places, and hope you won't get stuck with too many accidents, losses or heavy costs.
What makes Gear Jammers really fun are all the chances you take in hopes of collecting some profits. You may run into a truck stop that means you miss a couple of turns! We say "Go for the profits anyway!". If you own a fleet of trucks (and the value cards in your favour) you could be the ultimate winner of the game. But don't count on a thing until the timer goes off. Just when you think you've got the game in the bag, your old trucking buddy may land on a "Price and Profit!" card - and turn the whole game around.

Start your engines....roll out your trucks and begin driving on the highway to success....if you dare!

122651.name: Welcome to Mortiston, USA
122651.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to Mortiston, USA is a zombie apocalypse campaign setting book licensed for use with Outbreak: Undead, Savage Worlds and OGL Modern. The book details the events of a mysterious apocalypse that suddenly arises in a medium-sized American town. Cut off from the outside world in a mountain valley town 50 miles in any direction from other civilization, the surviving citizens of Mortiston barricade themselves into their homes. Some of them even make it through the night. Factions form as survivors come together, escape from the valley becomes impossible and survival becomes critical as resources begin to dwindle in the world after Z-Day.

Welcome to Mortiston, USA is an 76 page campaign setting and resource guidebook for use with nearly any modern apocalypse role-playing game. The guidebook contains 20 detailed npc survivors with their motivations, desires, equipment and stats in all three systems (Outbreak: Undead, Savage Worlds and Rotworld). It also contains 30 detailed locations with backgrounds, descriptions and equipment. Additionally it contains a timeline and other materials covering the events of Z-Day and roughly the first 200 days after Z-Day. The book takes into account dwindling resources and dying survivors over the time period so that the GM could, for example, know how much gasoline is likely to remain in a given gas station on Z-Day+75.

Welcome to Mortiston, USA is being published in both softcover book and pdf by Scrying Eye Games for release at Origins 2012 (May/June).

122652.description:
From the quick paced, deep decision rich, abstract strategy BattlessonTM game, Battle of 4 Armies, it's expansion kit has finally been brought to the fantastical battlefield. In the Battle of 4 Armies expansion kit: The Battle is Joined, a new Falcon Army spreads its wings and adds another element to the game. Each Hero (including the new army of flying units) now has a set of abilities that are both bold and cunning, giving you that extra chance to be victorious.

How will you sieze the Riverport of Chip? Find out with the Battle of 4 Armies expansion kit: The Battle is Joined!

Note, the Battle of 4 Armies Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Battle of 4 Armies to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Complexity: 1.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 8.5 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents a single troop of fantasy warriors.

Game Components:

• One 1-page, color instructions sheet
• 5 Hero cards
• 10 color, die-cut 1” mounted game pieces
122652.name: Battle of 4 Armies Expansion Kit: The Battle is Joined

122653.name: Die verrückte Bürokratie
122653.description:
A commercial game for 'Deutsche BP AG'. Produced by Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburg.

Each player draws some cards which determine the tiles they have to reach on the modular labyrinth-like board. Once a player has reached all the symbols stated on his cards he has to hurry back to his starting tile in order to win the game. However, the layout of the board is going to change through the course of the game by exchanging or switching/turning tiles - which of these actions take place is determined by the player in turn using a wheel as random generator.

122654.name: Rotworld
122654.description:
From the publisher's page:

...you pound the last nail in the board to secure the door even as the moaning and scratching becomes more frenzied outside. Honking in the driveway interrupts the sounds of undead hunger; peering through a window you see through the naked trees of fall that your husband, Ray, and the kids made it back.

"There must be a dozen rotters out there!" you observe in terror, as Ray leaps from the car, beating the dead walkers back with a tire iron to distract them from your two small children. The kids make it to the porch, just as one of the walking dead grasps Ray's arm and rips a sickeningly large chunk of meat out with its teeth.

They said on the radio that their bite will always spread the infection. You open the door and the kids scamper inside, but you slam it shut as Ray stumbles up.

"Wait!" his voice breaks.

But you know he's already dead.

"That's how we'll survive." you think, looking down at your two sobbing boys.

"It's us or them."

ROTWORLD is a game of survival horror against undead flesh eaters; it is a role-playing game complete in one volume. The game makes use of the Pacesetter System™, featured in such games as TIMEMASTER and in additional games forthcoming. These rules contain:


Rules for character generation
Guidelines for creating unique zombies for your game
Optional rules to account for decomposition in zombie abilities
Advice for determining the timeline of societal collapse

122655.name: Giana Sisters DS
122655.description:
From the back of the NA Nintendo DS edition case

"The Run 'n' Jump cult classics from the '80s is back!

Giana has returned! Get ready for her biggest adventure ever, as she braves a fantastic dreamworld in search of her lost diamonds. Take on a band of menacing enemies as Giana makes her way through 80+ new levels, unleashing a mighty arsenal of power-ups along the way!"

122656.name: Tabletop Bowling
122656.description: A desktop bowling set. Wooden base and pins, with a wooden ramp for launching the metal bowling ball which can be pivoted to aim shots. The base has a metal backstop. Scoring and pin setup must be done manually for each frame.

122657.name: Welt der Berliner
122657.description:
Objective: score most winning points knowing correct answers about Berlin.

With this quiz game the players will learn (with 220 questions) some detailed information about the city of Berlin.
2 different playing versions:
Version 1: active player draws a card and reads the question & 4 possible answers (of which 1, 2 or 3 may be right); now each player may invest gradually chips to be placed betting on different answers; correct answer(s) is(are) printed on the back of the card;
Version 2: find out the proper sequence of three answers regarding posted question

122658.name: Sqez
122658.description:
The playing-field of Sqez is a rectilinear array of dots, of any convenient size — but arrays of less than 8 x 8 are too small, and exceptionally large fields may prolong the game needlessly, unless there are many players. The easiest way to make the arrays is to type up rows of full-stops on a typewriter; but it's just possible that somewhere or other you can buy dotted paper (wallpaper?), and it wouldn't be hard to get used to playing on small-squared graph paper, counting each inter¬section as a 'dot'. But I leave this to your ingenuity.
Each player in Sqez must complete a rectangle (oblong or square) by drawing a line through the dots. The line drawn must not anywhere duplicate an already placed line, though it may cross another line, or meet it at one end; and the rectangle drawn must enclose at least one 'free' dot — a free dot being defined as a dot that has no line passing through it or originating at it. The last player to complete a legal move is the winner.
Those are the entire rules, except to say that a player who places a line which he cannot (owing to miscalculation) use to make a legal move (by completing a rectangle as defined) forfeits the game.

122659.name: Knight Force
122659.description:
From Wikipedia: Knight Force is a computer game developed by Titus Software in 1989 for the Amstrad CPC. The player is a champion who must travel to five different time zones in order to battle an evil magician who has captured a princess. The player must fight a variety of enemies in order to retrieve the correct amulet for each time zone. The player must also kill a number of clones of the magician in order to slay the real conjurer and rescue the princess.

Source: Wikipedia, "Knight Force," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122660.name: Kilroy 2: Chernobyl Farms
122660.description:
User Summary

A 3rd person shooter where you play as a hunter of mutants and uranium near and within the Chernobyl nuclear power plant.

122661.name: Welt des Films
122661.description:
Objective: Having the highest number of points after a certain number of question cards have been played (number to be decided by the players at the beginning of a game). Points are earned by correctly answering questions.

Trivia game with more than 200 questions about movies. Players choose for each question how many points they want to make and how risky they are willing to bet.

Gameplay: The starting player takes a card from the card stack, chooses a letter and reads the corresponding question and its answers. There are two types of questions:

- Questions with one to three correct answers: For each question, there are four answers. One up to three of them are correct, at least one is wrong. When all the answers have been read, the players place their chip(s) on the betting boards for the answer(s) that they think is/are correct. Each player (including the one who read the question) can place up to three chips. Players who put their chips on one or more wrong answers don't get any points this round. Players with exactly one correct answer get to advance their pawn one space, 2 correct answers means advancing 2 spaces, 3 correct answers 3 spaces.

122662.name: Kilroy
122662.description:
User Summary

A 3rd person shooter, where you play as a female sharpshooter, and have to shoot your way through an army of soldiers within a city.

122663.name: Kilroy 3: Return to Chernobyl
122663.description:
User Summary

The third game in the 3rd person shooter "Kilroy" series of Shockwave browser games. You have to navigate through the area around and inside the Chernobyl nuclear plant, and kill all the mutants.

122664.name: Zombie Gunship
122664.description:
"From the makers of the award-winning TowerMadness™, Zombie Gunship™ puts you in the gunner seat of a heavily-armed AC-130 ground attack aircraft. Strategically fire your powerful guns to slay endless waves of zombies and protect the remaining survivors of the zombie apocalypse!

3D NIGHT VISION DISPLAY with Motion Blur
Toggle between white and black hot modes. Use your radar to quickly detect and eliminate the zombie threat.

AUTHENTIC WEAPONS

25mm Gatling gun
40mm Bofors auto-cannon
105mm Howitzer cannon

COLLECT a BOUNTY for each ZOMBIE KILL
Use coins to upgrade your armaments and increase your zombie killing efficiency.

COMPETE FOR GLORY
Challenge your friends and other gunners on the Game Center Leaderboard!"

Source: The Developer Website.

122665.name: Zombie Kill Zone
122665.description:
User Summary

Zombie Kill Zone is a fun game in which you need to defend your town from a ravenous zombie horde, for this purpose you have more than 5 different kind of weapons. The enemy has 12 different kind of zombies to throw at you.

122666.name: Player's Handbook (HackMaster 5th Edition)
122666.description:
From the Introduction:

Well met, friend. You've made it this far, so congratulations are certainly in order for you’ve chosen the greatest game ever developed by mankind: HACKMASTER. At this point, a fair warning is probably in order. In all likelihood you cut your teeth on another game system and have either picked this game up as a curiosity or plan to move to HackMaster as a temporary or permanent change of pace. The more you play HackMaster, the more you will come to realize that it behaves differently than other games. For most games, having some preconceived notion of what to expect or background experience makes the transition easier. This is often not so with HackMaster; in fact, complete gaming newbs sometimes command a distinct learning-curve advantage over their seasoned RPG counterparts. This is because while HackMaster plays like an old-school game, it more closely models real-life than any previous edition (old or new school), despite its fluid mechanics. So rather than spend the introduction to this exalted tome blathering on about how great the designers are or how devoted HackMaster fans are we will simply cover some fundamental differences with which you will need to become accustomed, all in the hopes of saving a few of your character’s lives. In other words, this might be the first useful introduction ever penned (being as how I haven’t read them all – I usually skip them – I cannot certify this as the strict truth). Here are some things you will find different about HackMaster than other games:

- You needn’t ever wait for your turn – the whole game is based on the ‘seconds’ system, much like timekeeping in the real world. If your character wants to take an action or change his mind in the middle of an action, by all means, do it! No sense standing around

- Both shields and armor make it easier for foes to hit your character – they simply absorb damage and deflect blows, making your character less likely to be injured. Just like in real-life!

- Characters use an active defense (and roll to defend as well as attack); a low roll isn't the end of the world. So you rolled a six against that orc? Don't whine about missing until the GM rolls for the hobgoblin's defense. You still have a chance – he may roll a five.

- Going first and fastest is not always best. Charging into a group of surprised foes may be great for the first strike, but it may also be a way to find yourself surrounded if your allies aren't as quick as you.

- Being surrounded or even outnumbered is a very bad thing. Taking on multiple foes, even if far inferior to your character, can be bad news. A large group of orcs will be a tough fight even for high-level characters when in other games this would be a cake-walk. It wasn’t in the Mines of Moria and it won’t be in HackMaster, either.

- Ranged weapons don't work quite as well in real-life (or for low level characters) as they do in most recent RPGs. Frankly, I’d rather be shot with an arrow from a longbow than hit with a broad sword if forced to make that choice. Think about it.

- Every character cannot do everything and no character is an island. HM is a game of hard choices for each character. You need a TEAM of characters with complementary skills/abilities. HackMaster really is a game where you need to know the answer to the question, "Who's Watching Your Back?"

- Each character class has a specific role. Fighters fight and should be in front. Mages should be kept out of melee at all costs Thieves should be on point but ready to let the fighters take the lead in combat. Clerics are the party's all around support. Each role is important to party survival. Playing a thief like a fighter, or worse a mage like a fighter, just gets the character, and sometimes the party, killed.

- All the min/maxing during character creation doesn't mean a thing if you don't use your brain during the game. That spreadsheet that managed to save you 4 BPs on your mage/thief’s Lying skill doesn't mean much if you try to straight-up melee a troll.

- 3d6 in order does NOT mean you usually get an unplayable character – HackMaster drags the average 3d6 character ability back to 10-11 from 15-16.

- Intelligence is important in melee – it increases your chance to hit an enemy. That’s why the stupid giant can be defeated by the clever warrior.

- There are no perfect characters, but there are many different ways to create a great character.

- You can never tell the outcome of a battle before it starts - just because your fighter is at full hit points doesn't mean killing that goblin with the spear is a sure thing.

- Simply because you've encountered goblins/kobolds/zombies in other games doesn't mean they're just as easy to defeat in HackMaster.

- The GM is not out to kill you – he’s out to kill you if you are foolish. A tactical withdrawal is a perfectly acceptable option – far more often than in other games you’ll wind up in over your head.

In the end, the best advice I can give you is that HackMaster is a game of difficult choices. You will never have enough building points to buy everything you want (or even need). There is not one ‘no brainer’ weapon that every combatant should use, nor is there one class that bests them all. The BEST advice is to just play the game with an open mind, ready to learn. Nothing brings out the genius of HackMaster like actual play. During play you begin to see how well the system flows and works. This is a Game written by people who love to play it.

122667.name: ZombiePanic
122667.description:
User Summary

Zombies have attacked and there are a bunch of survivors left, your goal is to rescue them right away while at the same time killing as many zombies as you can. The game has various levels of gameplay difficulty, more than kind of weapons and 24 different zombie enemies

122668.name: Celtic Knots
122668.description:
User Summary

Celtic Knots combines parts of jigsaw puzzles and sliders.

A Celtic Knot design has been cut into tiles and jumbled. Connect all the loops to solve the puzzle.

The free version has 54 knots, the paid version has 84 knots at launch with more planned.

122670.description:
Ausgerechnet Köln uses the same game play as the other Ausgerechnet! titles: Players deal three piles of 15 location cards from a deck of roughly 200 cards (naming locations related to Cologne for this edition), then place an interlude card between each set of piles to make a deck of 45 cards. One location card is placed on the direction board, which has arrows pointing north, south, east and west.

On a turn, a player draws a location card – keeping the latitude and longitude on the back of the card secret from all players – then places the card next to the direction board, indicating how she thinks this location relates to the starting one. Is 'Nippes' west or east of Bonn? Why sure, so place it by the west arrow. Location cards can be placed between cards already on the board.

After each location card is placed, any player can challenge the positioning of that card. That player reveals the back of the most recently placed card as well as one adjacent card. If the challenge was correct – and the card placed wrongly – the challenger wins a point chip from the placer and the card is removed; otherwise the challenger hands over a chip to that person.

After 15 cards are placed, the interlude card signals an interim scoring in which all players secretly guess how many cards have been placed correctly. Guess correctly, and you score two chips; if no one is spot on, the closest guesser wins a chip.

After three rounds and the final interlude scoring, the player with the most chips wins.
122670.name: Ausgerechnet Köln

122672.name: Pirates of Legend
122672.description:
From the Mongoose Website:

"‘A pyrate is Hostis humanis generis, a common Enemy, with whom neither Faith nor Oath is kept… if Pyracy be committed on the Ocean, and the Pyrates in the attempt be overcome, the Captors may, without any Solemnity of Condemnation, hang them up at the Main Yard; if they are brought to the next port and the Judge rejects the Tryal, or the Captors cannot wait for the Judge, without Peril or Loss, Justice may be done upon them by the Captors.’

Pirates of Legend brings the golden age of piracy to life! Lay hand to your cutlass and stick your pistols in your belt, friend – adventure is waiting for you offshore. Band together with other scurvy dogs and take command of a ship and crew. Lead them to victory and plunder, or to a watery grave! Win fame and fortune or dangle at the end of the yardarm when the Navy catches up with you!

The shining blue waters of the Caribbean lie before you and the wind is in your sails. What you do next is up to you!"

122673.description:
Aliens, UFOs – are they real? After years of research, Ufologists have answered this question, and the answer is...maybe. This is where you come in. Gather evidence, get your Doctorate, hack your opponent's computer, then – perhaps – you will solve one of the World's greatest mysteries: Are we alone in the universe?

Ufology is a card game based on the fringe scientific field of the same name. In Ufology, players use Research cards to collect Evidence cards from a 3x3 card grid (3x4 in 5-6 player games) called the Field of Research. Those Evidence cards, ranging in value from 0 to 6 points, are placed with Case cards that have corresponding icons. When a Case has the indicated pieces of evidence, it is considered Closed. The game ends as soon as a player closes three Cases, and the player with the most points wins.

Action cards allow players to, for instance, take cards from an opponents hands, move cards from Case to another, etc. There are also Credentials cards that increase the number of cards a player may use on there turn or their hand size, and Culture cards which change the game play for all players.
122673.name: Ufology

122674.name: Nuclear Zombie 2000
122674.description:
User Summary

At the dawn of the year 2000, the Y2K bug caused terrible death and destruction across the land. Planes crashed, computers went haywire, and even zombies rose from the dead. You play as one man prepared for this disaster, Bobby, a security guard at the Crimson Fall nuclear power plant. You can fight through hordes of zombies, rescue survivors, escape, stop the place from exploding, and more. The game is a retro-style 2D platform/shooter with a short time limit and multiple endings and achievements.

122675.name: Wasteland 2

videogamehonor.35054: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Sci-fi Game of the Year Nominee

122675.description:
User Summary

Wasteland 2 is the direct sequel to the first ever post-apocalyptic computer RPG, Wasteland (the inspiration for the Fallout series of games). Play is turn-based, with an isometric view.

It is be set in a dangerous, post-apocalyptic world in the American Southwest. Over the course of adventures rangers receive promotions, acquire new skills and equipment, then face new challenges with outcomes that change depending on the strategy used to defeat them. The game features a strong storyline requiring painful decisions by players; and a storyline that will allow for maximum re-playability.

122676.name: Lands Unknown
122676.description:
In Lands Unknown you control a group of bold adventurers who embark on a journey into an unexplored continent. They will have to plan their advance carefully and use the terrain to their advantage if they are to best rivaling groups for control of the continent.

Each turn, a player plays a land card onto one of the coastline roads already started, marks it (if necessary), then uses the power shown on that (drawing new cards, swapping hands with an opponent, moving tokens, destroying cards or tokens, and so on). At the end of the game, players score points for their explorer tokens on the roads, and the player with the most points wins.

122678.name: Flipkick
122678.description:
"The New Game of Table Football".

Fairly basic game of finger-flicking dexterity. The box illustrates it rather well.

The board is anything you can find to act as a board, maybe an old blanket. The wire supports fasten the goals and the blanket to the table. Up to 4 can play. With your finger, you literally flick the ball, hopefully goalwards. There are no player figures so I expect the game got quite frenetic, especially with four players.

The most goals wins.

122679.name: Daffy Duck: Fowl Play
122679.description:
User Summary:

Daffy Duck Fowl Play is a game featuring Daffy Duck. The game was released in 1999 by Sunsoft. The game is compatible with both the original Game Boy and Game Boy Color.

In this side-scrolling platform game Daffy Duck has to go on a quest through 9 levels to find a hidden treasure, but other members from the Looney Tunes cast try to stop him from succeeding.

122680.description:
The board is wooden (made of exotic hardwood), into which there are 21 half-inch diameter holes. Basically the positional shape of the holes is a five times five grid with corners removed:


5 ooo
4ooooo
3ooooo
2ooooo
1 ooo
ABCDE


The dark player has seven dark shafted game pieces to control. The light player has seven light shafted game pieces to control. Each game piece is formed as a stick which will fit nicely into any of the holes. Each piece has coloured caps at the end in six combinations:

1.) yellow / orange
2.) orange / red
3.) red / purple
4.) purple / blue
5.) blue / green
6.) green / yellow

Game rules give the hint that these form a circle of colours. This information might help and can be used to find logical game strategies here.

The seventh piece being special is

7.) white / black

Colour white is used being a 'wild' (joker). It can be used as a legal replacement for any colour mentioned before.
Black is basically a blocker not representing any colour.

Players take alternating turns. When a game piece is placed in a hole one of the coloured end caps is obviously not visible anymore. Placing a game piece the non visible colour must be announced loudly and clearly enough to the opponent while setting the piece.

On his first turn a player must place one of his pieces into any free hole. After the first turn a turn consists of one of the following actions:

1.) Play another own offboard piece into another free hole, or
2.) Turn any one of your already played pieces upside down in the same hole (announcing the non visible colour towards the opponent clearly and loudly), or
3.) Move any one of your played pieces to another hole (but not turning it upside down)

The object is to get three of the same colour in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) and the first player to do so wins. Since each player's set contains only two caps of each colour (as listed above), at least one of the three-in-a-row might has to be an opponent's piece.

The 'wild' game piece can only be played as soon as all other six pieces are already set before. This way you can build and win creating a three-in-a-row using own and/or opponent's white game piece as well. The black colour can not be used in a three-in-a-row constellation since it is used as a blocking piece only.

In general each player can only move game pieces with a shaft of own colour. But any game piece can be used to form the three-in-a-row to win.

Initially you draw by lot who goes first. In consecutive rounds the previous loser takes the first turn.

You might find similarities in game play like in Quarto (published in 1991, using opponent's pieces as well to form the winning row) and Memory (published in 1959, remembering the hidden colours is definitively helpful).

In contrast to Tau the newer Calypso does not include the aspect of a Memory game any longer. The colour which is not visible in Tau (and has to be announced each time) is still visible in Calypso due to the other construction of the game pieces.
122680.name: Tau

122681.name: Vertex Dispenser
122681.description:
Vertex Dispenser is a fast-paced abstract strategy game with mathematical puzzle elements. Wrestle for control of territory on bizarre geometric worlds. Carefully plan your conquests to maximise the colours of your vertices, capture solid faces to defend them, then eradicate your enemies with a variety of special attacks.

Source: The Developer Website.

122682.name: Looney Tunes: Carrot Crazy
122682.description:
User Summary:

Bugs Bunny & Lola Bunny: Carrot Crazy (Named 'Bugs Bunny & Lola Bunny: Operation Carrot Patch' in Europe) is a game published by Infogrames in 1998. The game is compatible with both Game Boy and Game Boy Color.
In the game the player controls either Bugs Bunny or Lola Bunny on a quest to retrieve the carrots that were stolen by some of the other Looney Tunes cast members. The gameplay consists of side scrolling platform action and takes the player through five different areas, with a boss at the end of each area.

122683.name: Marvin Strikes Back!

videogameversion.160483: North American Game Boy Color edition

122683.description:
Looney Tunes: Marvin Strikes Back! (Looney Tunes Collector: Martian Revenge in Europe) is a Looney Tunes game published by Infogrames for the Game Boy Color in 2001. It is both a direct and spiritual sequel to Looney Tunes Collector: Alert!, as both share near-identical gameplay.

The game takes place after the events of Looney Tunes Collector: Alert!. Marvin the Martian sees a video of himself played by Porky Pig and Daffy Duck beating him in a humiliating way. Marvin is infuriated with this and together with his dog K-9 set off to get revenge on the Earth.

The gameplay is very similar to that of the prequel. This time, however, the story is from Marvin's perspective. Marvin's basic controls are walking and shooting. Due to this, he needs to mainly rely on other characters such as Speedy Gonzales. There are a total of 45 characters to find in this game. These can be traded and won in multiplayer mode. It is compatible with its predecessor, giving the player a chance to connect the two games together and transfer characters collected in that game to the latter game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Marvin Strikes Back!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122684.name: Space Jam
122684.description:
From the back of the box:

It's the ultimate pick-up game. Michael Jordan, Bugs Bunny, Porky Pig, Daffy Duck and Lola Bunny vs. a mean team of outlandish alien Monstars! This is intergalactic hoops according to the Big Slam Theory! Extraterrestrial dunks! Anti-gravitational alley-oops! Stellar gameplay! And a bunch of mini-games overstuffed with wacky cartoon mayhem. Earth just wasn't big enough. SPACE JAM!

122685.name: Sylvester and Tweety in Cagey Capers
122685.description:
From the back of the box:

This legendary Looney Tunes duo make their video game debut - and what a performance! The eyepopping, cartoon like animation and ribtickling shenanigans seem never ending as you twy, twy, twy and twy again to swipe the little Tweety - with cat-astrophic results!

122686.name: Taz
122686.description:
From the back of the box:

Gain high scores instead of pounds as you take Taz, the ravenous TASMANIAN DEVIL, on a feeding frenzy. The better you play, the more fattening foods come your way - hamburgers, rootbeer, ice cream... Just watch out for dynamite! If Taz ets that - POW! - he'll get an awful bellyache.

- Whirlwind action!
- Scrumptious gameplay!
- A veritable video game feast!

122687.description:
This edition aims at elder players and offers questions from the following categories:

Blue: Sport & Leisure
Pink: Health & Diet
Yellow: Travel & Regeneration
Brown: Personalities & Celebrities
Green: History & Politics
Orange: Culture

The rules follow the standard Trivial Pursuit games:

Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.
122687.name: Trivial Pursuit: Evergreen

122688.name: Tazmanian Devil: Munching Madness
122688.description:
Tasmanian Devil: Munching Madness is a video game developed by M4 Ltd. and released by Sunsoft in 1999 for the Game Boy Color. The game stars the Looney Tunes character Tasmanian Devil.

The game is a platform game played from an overhead perspective. Players take control of Taz to eat all the food in each of the nine levels - Tasmania, Australia, China, Greece, Switzerland, Amsterdam, Amazon River, Las Vegas and Transylvania. On the way, players must also collect medallions and attack enemies by using Taz's signature spin or by spitting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tasmanian Devil: Munching Madness," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122689.name: Wild Guns
122689.description:
High noon.

The dirt crunches underneath your boots.

Sweat drips slowly down your brow.

Your fingers twitch as you reach for your gun.
