The game covers the Dark Tournament story arc in which Yusuke and his allies are invited by a powerful demon named Toguro to participate in a deadly martial arts tournament.

Dark Tournament is a 3D versus fighting game where the player progresses by completing specific objectives tied to a combat system. These objectives range from following simple commands to full-out battles with opponent characters. Each unique character can utilize a number of basic moves as well stronger “spirit” attacks. Dark Tournament was developed by Digital Fiction and published by Atari in North America and Europe as part of a distribution deal for the latter. Both the animation company Studio Pierrot and English licensor Funimation had limited involvement in the game’s production.

As a fighting game, a large majority of Dark Tournament relies on its combat system. The player is able to move within a straight line on a 3D arena. The purpose of each battle is to deplete an opponent’s health while maintaining one’s own, although a participant may win by forcing an opponent out of the ring. Each of the game’s 25 player characters has a specific set of basic punches, kicks, blocks, throws, and combo moves. In addition, characters have access to powerful “spirit” attacks once a meter located below one's health fills to capacity. This meter fills as opponents exchange hits with each other. Dark Tournament features a story mode which is divided into 31 chapters, progressing linearly through the plot of the manga and anime. The mode features different objectives relating to the narrative. For instance, one chapter requires the player to trade blows with the drunken master Chu in a match that restricts either character from moving or dodging. Other chapters allow the player to use multiple characters in battle using a tag team system.

Other, optional gameplay modes include a training mode for learning each character’s moves; an arcade mode, where the player fights through a series of chosen opponents; a multiplayer Skirmish mode; and a token minigame, which plays like a modified version of the card game War. Initially, only five characters (Yusuke, Kuwabara, Kurama, Hiei, and The Masked Fighter) are playable in these modes. However, as the player advances through the story mode, other characters are added to playable roster, alternate costumes are made available, more tokens can be used in the token game, and two extra modes (Survival and Dark Tournament Plus) are unlocked.

Source: Wikipedia, "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122787.name: The Paladin
122787.description:
User summary:

This includes a character sheet and rules summary for players of Dungeon World Basic using the Paladin character class. It was included as a bonus for those who purchased the softcover version of the Dungeon World Basic Roleplaying Game.

122788.name: Battle Arena Toshinden Remix
122788.description:
User Summary

Battle Arena Toshinden Remix is a modified port of the original Battle Arena Toshinden and was released exclusively on the Sega Saturn. The game boosts the total number of fighters from 8 in the original to 9 in Remix. Aside from some slight graphical tweaks, the crucial difference between Remix and the PlayStation original is that this game utilizes the Saturn controller, which was specifically designed with fighting games in mind.

122789.name: Antiques Roadshow
122789.description:
Trivia game with the theme of the questions being on different areas of antique collecting; Porcelain, Silver, Paintings, and so on. The game is licenced by the BBC who have been broadcasting the Antiques Roadshow for well over 20 years.

The object is to answer enough questions correctly to 'build' a medallion. When assembled (10 correct answers in all), you must answer one more question from the subject of your choice and if you get it right, you win.

One particular aspect makes it a true family game. The questions takes three forms. At the start decide if you are an Expert, an Enthusiast, or an Amateur. If you are an Expert, then you get the question as is. If you are an Enthusiast, you get three possible answers and must choose one of the. If you are an Amateur, you get two possible answers and must choose one. Thus children can play with adults quite happily.

122790.name: Shoot Many Robots
122790.description:
Shoot Many Robots is a 4-player co-op, run-n'-gun action shooter. Published by Ubisoft, it's Demiurge Studios' first original title, and it's available for digital download on Xbox Live Arcade, PlayStation Network, and PC.

The game stars P. Walter Tugnut, a lovable hillbilly who's been stock-piling his RV with guns, ammo, and beer awaiting the robot apocalypse. In case you're wondering, the "P" stands for "Pickles" - but don't call him that.

Source: The Developer Website.

122791.name: Creatures Below the Shattered Moon!
122791.description:
Publisher Blurb:

After the cracking of the moon and before the rise of Atlantis the world was a place strange to the thoughts of honest men. The death throes of science amid the birth of magic sculpted new generations of conquerors who strode the lands forging civilizations of steel, sinew, and sorcery from the decrepit hulks of the ones that fell before. Tyrannical wizards, amoral super-scientists, charismatic catalysts, and multifarious mutants battled for wealth, power, and honor. It was ten thousand years of barbarity; ten thousand years spent in the shadowy shells of past glories, hiding from horrible creatures that scratched and skittered for blood; ten thousand years of tyranny and injustice, ten thousand years of Sorcery & Super Science!

Expeditious Retreat Press unveils 52 new creatures for Sorcery & Super-Science! Surprise your players with a new bevy of critters that live below the shattered moon.

user comment
this printed book appears to be combination of the 52 creatures listed in the 3 PDFs
Creatures Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 1 .. 17 creatures
Creatures Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 2 .. 16 creatures
Creatures Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 3 .. 19 creatures

122792.name: Birds of Steel
122792.description:
PRESS RELEASE

Get ready to strap in, go back in time and take stick in the most pivotal battles in the history of air combat. Birds of Steel puts you right in the crosshairs of WWII's most intense skirmishes.

This original IP blends next gen supremacy and the fine details of aerial combat into a historical recreation fit for flight sim fans and history buffs alike. Use your skills to pilot the top planes from all combatants in WWII to recreate history or to change the outcomes of the most prolific battles in history. Online and offline elements add an entire new element to the game which will ensure Birds of Steel remains a fresh combat experience long after you've played for the first time.

Key features:

Over 100 real life planes — Dog fight and dive bomb in actual WW2 planes and rain down terror from above. Determine for yourself which plane is the ultimate bird of prey.

Navigate through hundreds missions — Embark on 20 historical missions, hundreds of procedural missions scattered throughout 16 different locations. All are inspired by real life campaigns such as Pearl Harbor, Guadalcanal and the battle of Wake Island. Reality is reflected using real life maps and actual satellite photos of these areas.

Pioneering online and multi-player modes for flight sims — Enjoy 4 player co-op or go into the new and unique online ware mode to compete against up to 16 aviators across world. More exciting details to come!

Key innovations — The finest details are the most critical in the new physics and damage models. Controlling speed is a direct result of effect manipulation of the ailerons, and rudders. Each plane has over 100 hitpoints where each part of the plane has its own health and damage detection.

Fun for all gamers — Multiple levels of realism offer a gameplay experience for gamers of all walks: Simplified, Realistic up to Simulator for the serious flight-sim players.

Source: The Game Website.

122793.name: Poor Brendan's Almanac
122793.description:
From the Introduction

Why does a game whose original publisher has been non-existent for almost twenty years need a supplement?

Some of the materials included in this supplement seemed (to me, anyway) obviously lacking in the original DragonQuest game, and were practically begging to be written up. Other items came about as the course of several campaigns progressed, and rules were needed for things which DragonQuest did not cover. Poor Brendan’s Almanac was developed out of a set of in-house rules and modifications to DragonQuest (2nd Edition) used in several campaigns going back as far as 1981. Although it has existed in a fairly fixed form for nearly 10 years, it is only relatively recently that a reasonable means of distributing it (namely the Internet) has been broadly available.

The DragonQuest community on the Internet has developed into a small but devoted core of players and GMs. This supplement is dedicated to all of you who have contributed to the DragonQuest Newsletter, or written to WebRPG or the dqn-list or one of the other DragonQuest discussion forums or newsgroups. Your presence and continued support for DragonQuest makes it worthwhile to produce this project. Some material in this supplement has been previously distributed through the DragonQuest Newsletter.

Two versions of Poor Brendan’s Almanac will be available. This one is a smaller file with lower-resolution images. A second file with higher resolution images (suitable for making a laser printed copy of the book) will also be produced. Both files are machine-readable with Adobe Acrobat software. We have tried, as much as has been possible, to reproduce the look-and-feel of an SPI supplement, as well as making the content follow in the spirit and style of the original DragonQuest game.

Like the original DragonQuest game itself, there is nothing to keep there from being a future Second Edition of Poor Brendan’s Almanac. Feedback and commentary are the best ways to work out the bugs and to help make this more useful for everyone.
Hopefully, you will find this a useful addition to the DragonQuest rules and use it in your campaigns. Please feel free to print out and distribute copies of this supplement to other DragonQuest players, within the extent of acceptable use.

User Summary

This fan-created effort was distributed for free on the Internet.

122794.name: Happy New Year
122794.description:
Card game using a regular deck of cards and a board.

"The Board represents a typical year; a constant struggle to pay endless bills with a fixed income and a few opportunities of supplementing it. But with good management and more good luck than bad, it is just possible to get through the year with a few pounds saved! The winner of the game is the first person who proves he can do so."

You start the year with 100 pounds, and every player starts on January 1st.

On your turn you may play a card of your choice that matches the suit on the square on the board that you are currently on. If you do, you move that many spaces equivalent to the card that you played (Jack = 11, Queen = 12, King =13). The square you now land on will dictate the suit you should play next turn so that you can advance again. Squares you land on will have good or bad instructions (Gain 6 pounds, lose 9 pounds for example), and so on.

You win the game if you have at least 100 pounds and a card that will take you to New Year's Eve.

122795.name: All Aboard!
122795.description:
All Aboard! is a pre-school game for 3 to 5 year olds. Match colours and shapes as you collect your passengers. Two games in one!
Game 1: Roll the colour spot dice to collect the coloured windows for your vehicles.
Game 2: Turn your vehicle over and all aboard as you spin the spinner and collect passengers in shaped windows.
The winner of each game is to fill up your train respectively.

Contents:
4 double-sided playing boards
24 square coloured cards
24 shaped passenger cards
Spinner
Colour spot dice
Dice cup
Rules

122796.name: Double Frustration
122796.description:
Another game that use the Pop-o-matic dice facility.

Each player tries to remove their two pieces from the board. Each piece that lands on one of the Finish spaces is removed.

There are four wheels built into the board. When you land on a Star space, you must turn a wheel. If pieces are on the chosen wheel then they will stay there but may have to exit on to a different route than they intended. Thus you can help yoursef or hinder your opponents.

122797.name: Peter Rabbit's Puzzle Game
122797.description:
A game for younger children.

On their turn, each player rolls a regular die. The number they roll indicates which part of their Beatrix Potter character card that they can 'assemble'. Unusually for these sort of games, like Beetle, is that you need nine parts to your character. Number 1 represents each corner piece so you will need to roll a 1 four times to assemble each corner of your picture.

The first to finish their Peter Rabbit character picture, wins.

122798.name: Euro Austria Börse Quiz
122798.description: There are 100 cards each with 5 questions and 3 answers in each card. The goal is to learn of financial transactions, stock exchange and other technical terms. Correct answers are marked according to budget in the index, an incorrect answer will forfeit the round budget. At the end of game player with the highest number of exchange points wins the game.

122799.name: J'achète
122799.description:
Tactical board game where you have to shop as quickly as possible while managing its budget. Each player receives 12 euros and its shopping list.
In her turn player roll the dice and moves her pawn in the direction of her choice. Every time she lands on a colored box she can make a purchase in the store of the same color. She then roll the dice to determine Euros she may use. The amount sets her budget and she decides whether to buy. The winner is the first that comes out of the market with all purchases in her shopping list!

122800.description:
A German subsidiary card set for use with any Trivial Pursuit master game with specific questions about Bavaria. The game contains 500 cards with 6 questions each from the following 6 categories:

Blue: Geographie (Geography)
Pink: Unterhaltung (Entertainment)
Yellow: Historie (History)
Brown: Kultur (Culture)
Green: Weiß-Blau (White-Blue)
Orange: Sport & Freizeit (Sport & Leisure)

The questions in the green category (white-blue) center around slang terms and very specific bavarian topics, making it very hard for non-bavarians to answer.
122800.name: Trivial Pursuit: Bayern Edition

122801.name: Fight On! (Issue 9 - Spring 2010)
122801.description:
From the publisher's website:

When you're down to your last hit point, your last spell, the last charge on your laser pistol - what now? Fight On! Issue #9 is here, stampeding out of the gate with adventures big and small, a city-state, races, classes, monsters, spells, tricks, traps, tables, rules options, random encounters, NPCs, and a motherlode of mighty miscellaneous mysteries to give your game a boost! Dedicated to Paul Jaquays, this issue features contributions from Jeff Rients, Sang Lee, Tavis Allison, Kelvin Green, Geoffrey McKinney, Patrick Farley, Zak S., Erik Battle, James Quigley, Mark Allen, Jennifer Weigel, Gabor Lux, Peter Schmidt Jensen, Ed Heil, Paul Fini, Raven Daegmorgan, Eric Minton, Allen Varney, Baz Blatt, Geoffrey O. Dale, Jerry Stratton, Chris Robert, Calithena, Jeff Talanian, and many, many more!

122802.description:
This is a promotional edition of the classic trivia game Trivial Pursuit, published by an Austrian radio station to celebrate its thirtieth birthday.

The game contains 250 trivia cards with 6 questions each from the following categories:

Blue: Radio, TV und Kinohits (Radio, TV and movie hits)
Pink: Ö3erlei (specific questions about the radio station)
Yellow: Popgeschichte & Hitparade (Pop history & hit parade)
Brown: Prominente & Austro-Stars (Celebrities & Austrian stars)
Green: Sport (Sports)
Orange: Zeitgeschehen & Politik (Events of the day & politics)

Every player gets a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes (standard Trivial Pursuit issue). There is no game board. A special six-sided die showing the six colors mentioned above is rolled by the player on turn. The color tells from which category the question comes.

If the player on turn can answer the question, he gets another turn and, if he does not has it already, the corresponding colored pie piece which he puts in his playing piece. If he answers wrong, it's the next player's turn.

The first player to collect all colors wins the game.

Although it can be played stand-alone, the set is fully compatible with every other Trivial Pursuit game.
122802.name: Trivial Pursuit: Hitradio Ö3

122803.name: Spanish-American War
122803.description:
Relive the war the destroyed an empire and herald the rise of a new empire in the Spanish American War! Play the Cuban theater, or the Pacific theater! Or combine them!

Players choose which theater they want to take operations on per turn and take as many actions as they want. But the American has to worry about the Spanish player's mines that he is allowed to place concealed on the sea zone. With these advantages... Can the Spanish Player change history or will the superior American troops win again?

122804.name: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Battles
122804.description:
Zatch Bell! Mamodo Battles, known as Konjiki no Gash Bell!!:: Yuujou Tag Battle 2!! in Japan, is a 3D fighting game based on the Zatch Bell! anime series. The game depicts the storyline of the manga and anime just prior to the Ancient Mamodo arc.

Every one thousand years, one hundred mamodo descend upon the earth to fight the ultimate battle. The winning mamodo becomes the mighty king of the mamodo world. There is only one problem - in order for the mamodo to use their powerful spell books, they need a human partner.

With the story mode, the player can choose one of six characters to use and play through a unique campaign for each character. The game also has a time attack mode that scores the player after battling eight opponents, and a practice mode that allows the player to train against a dummy opponent. As the player progresses and spends time in the game, they earn points that can be used to unlock upgraded characters. Points can also be used to purchase unlockable cards.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zatch Bell! Mamodo Battles", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122805.name: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury
122805.description:
Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury (金色のガッシュベル!! 激闘!最強の魔物達 Konjiki no Gash Bell!! Gekitou! Saikyou no mamonotachi, lit. Golden Gash Bell!! Clash! Strongest Demons) is a fighting game released on the PlayStation 2. The original Japanese version was published by Bandai at the end of 2005, after merging with Namco but before the formation of Namco Bandai Games. The subsequent international releases and the GameCube versions were published under Namco Bandai Games. The game is based on the Zatch Bell! anime franchise.

Story Mode: Play is done over the course of 40 levels consisting of different opponents. Often special conditions will need to be met, such as defeating an opponent with Bao Zakeruga. Note that this does not necessarily mean that the opponent be at minimum health. In addition to the regular Story Mode there is a series of mini games which are consolidated into "Zatch's Diary". These follow every day situations in Zatch's life. Previously played levels can be reselected either to improve rating or on higher difficulties.

Arcade Mode: Choose a character and fight against eight opponents. Once completed, a special cut-scene for the chosen character will play that contains dialogue between the mamodo and his or her partner. After the scene concludes you will see the statistics of all eight matches. These statistics determine the chance of the mamodo becoming King. To receive a 100% rating, all matches must be one with an "A" rating.

VS. Mode: This is a traditional one-on-one battle. Choose any character and stage and begin fighting immediately. Play can either be against CPU opponents or other people via two controllers. A ranking up system is also available. Stats for individual characters can be upgraded by the obtaining of "Mamodo Points", which are distributed after the conclusion of a match. The amount of points given is based on the aforementioned ranking system, with "A" being the best and "E" being the worst.

4P Battle: Meant as more of a party mode, the 4P battles are in the form of mini games. These include "Burn the Spell Book", which has each player try to kick another's spell book into a small campfire, among others.

Mini-Games: This game mode contains seven mini games where certain goals must be completed. One level requires you to find 30 lollipops and give them to Kanchome within 80 seconds.

Gallery: The Gallery is split into several subtypes: the Model Gallery, which shows all the character models used in the game along with a short description of each; Visual Gallery, which has all the cut scenes from the Story Mode; Stage Gallery, which lets the player control Suzy Mizuno and roam freely along the multiplayer stages; and the Sound Gallery, which contains all the music from the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122806.name: The Twilight Horizon
122806.description:
From the pubishers homepage:

It's Getting Dark

The Horizon Corporation is everywhere. They’re in the trids you watch, the music you listen to, and the news you consume. They’re propping up hundreds of major brands of products across the planet with their public relations skill. And they’re spending countless hours studying how you—that’s right, you—think so that they can lead your mind like a master leads a spaniel.

Denizens of the Sixth World have long suspected that there is a dark side to Horizon, if only because the corporation seemed too good to be true. If there is a dark side, it seems likely to come out soon, as the corporation has been under tremendous pressure recently—technomancers are plotting against it, spirits are causing problems in the Mojave, and Aztechnology is on the offensive, intent on keeping the competition down. That pressure is going to result in an explosion somewhere, and when it does, Horizon and the Sixth World will be changed forever.

The Twilight Horizon is a campaign book involving shadowrunners in the inner workings of Horizon and the troubles surrounding the corporation. Everything is leading to a crisis, and the runners will need to use all their skills to come out alive on the other side. Filled with plot details, location information (including details about Las Vegas in the Sixth World), and NPC write-ups, the book throws Shadowrun players into a cyclone of corporations, spirits, criminals, and others looking to grab a small piece of Horizon’s immense power.

The Twilight Horizon is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

122807.name: Damage Control
122807.description:
From the publisher website:

The Sharks are Circling
When the great dragon Hestaby leveled Saeder-Krupp’s arcology in Dubai, a lot of people wondered if the success of her act meant that Lofwyr & co. were off their game. And of course, the corps of the Sixth World aren’t ones to just sit around and speculate—instead, they act. All of the sudden, corporations of all sizes are on the move, snatching up any Saeder-Krupp clients they can pry away, telling them that S-K can’t be trusted in the current turmoil.
Saeder-Krupp, though, is not about to let anyone believe they are weak. They're going to show that they should never be trifled with, and that clients would be well served to stay with them—or risk the wrath of Lofwyr. They’re bringing runners to Dubai to demonstrate that the largest megacorporation in the world still has strength to spare.
Damage Control is the first in the new Boardroom Backstabs series of adventures for Shadowrun. The series explores one of the classic Shadowrunthemes—corporate machinations where every handshake is made with crossed fingers, and the hand you can’t see is always holding a knife. There’s a lot of money to be made on this job, but runners better keep their wits about them if they want to keep all those corporate sharks from feeding on them.
Damage Control is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

122808.name: The OneeChanpurū:  The Onechan Special Chapter
122808.description:
The OneeChanpurū is an upgraded version of The OneeChanbara and includes two new characters: D3 Publisher idol Riho Futaba and her younger sister Makoto. Chanpurū is the name of an Okinawan meal, while oneechan means "big sister".

Source: Wikipedia, "Zombie Hunters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122809.description:
Board of Dreams is a baseball boardgame simulation.

Board of Dreams is a game for 2 players.
You will be manager of yours team.
There are so many players to choose to form their lineup, the pitchers who get tired easily and the team must be balanced when it replaces.

Each launch is called from players, and hit the ball may not always be the best choice to make.

Each element of the team has its own characteristics, fields exalt one or other player.

One board, two teams, two dices and 9 innings do you want more?
Just manage your team, pitch the ball, hit a home runs and win the game.

A few simple rules to a great passion, baseball.
122809.name: Board of Dreams

122810.name: The OneeChampon: The Onechan 2 Special Chapter
122810.description:
An upgraded version of The OneeChanbara 2 featuring returning characters Riho and Makoto, as well as the female warriors Kiku and Hana, the stars of Simple 2000 Series Vol. 87: The Nadesico (SIMPLE2000シリーズ Vol.87 THE 戦娘). Champon is the name of a Chinese meal.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zombie Hunters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122811.name: 1-2-X Das Bundesliga-Quiz
122811.description: Football enthusiasts can test their football knowledge around the Austrian football events. It addresses questions about the entire Austrian Bundesliga. The aim of the game is to answer questions in 5 areas of knowledges from the beginning to the presence of the Austrian football properly. Who was the first after completion of the two halves of play by reaching the goal-box wins the game.

122812.name: Tribes of Legend
122812.description:
A hardback book featuring three games based on Greek mythology. The three sets are:

Tribes of Legend: This is a miniatures game involving armies of humans, centaurs and satyrs. Combat is dice-driven, movememtn is simple, and the basic grouping for all activities is the unit (as opposed to individual figures). Rules are provided for terrain effects, and each faction has its own special rules. The overall game rules are very simple, shunning the usual complexity of miniatures rules.

Ancient Heroes: a miniatures skirmish game for smaller battles. This is a playing card driven battle game, where individual figures move around the tabletop and draw cards to perform tasks and fight battles. Different fighting abilities and levels of armour are represented by differing card values in the game. Ordinary playing cards are used to play with.

Trials of a Demigod: a solitaire quest driven by action cards.This is mostly an exercise in pulling cards and seeing the total they add up to - nicely presented but not very much of a game.

122813.name: Auf dem Weg zum Millionär
122813.description: A quiz game, designed specifically as a travel game, for a 2 to 20 players, easy to carry and easy to play, you only need paper and pencil or the attached answer sheet. The two issues are separate sections for adults and children, the reader identifies the question number and reads the question and four answers. The players write the answer they think is right on the sheet and lay face down in the middle. If all answers are given, players with the correct answer get one point. Who has the most points at end of the game is the winner

122815.name: Mal-Attacke
122815.description:
The players have to draw a word that their teammates have to guess before time runs out. But that's not so easy, because 6 different categories representing more difficult. The painter must, depending on the category, draw the image upside down, paint standing with the "other" hand, humming, or standing on one leg etc.

Team who finish first the "winner's circle" wins the game!

122816.name: Apex of the Racing
122816.description:
Apex Of The Racing(AKA, AOTR), is a racing game on providing the thrill of the sliding on the corners. It represents a different view the racing world compared to other racing game in the market.

EASY SLIDING AND AGREESSIVE TURNING CHANLLENGES
Just tilt the devices a little harder to make the car sliding in the corners.

FANTASTIC JOURNEY FROM REALITY TO FICTIONS.
16 tracks plus 4 special offered ones are fully polished to drive you from colorful night cities, peaceful country of different cultures to mysterious special offers.

CHANLLENGE YOUR SKILLS
3 different game modes requires you drive with different strategy and skills.

DRIVE WITH THE WORLD
You could upload your record to leaderboards and compete with player worldwide by downloading records from the leaderboards.

Source: The Game Website.

122817.name: Star Warfare: Alien Invasion
122817.description:
USER SUMMARY: This game is a third-person "survival" shooter, in which players team up to defeat waves of enemies across a series of alien levels.

Online PvP mode added!!
1. Added two maps for team death match and free for all modes
2. Increased mithril drop rate for first and second time per day
3. Added two suits, one backpack and one weapon
4. Fixed zero reward for guest users bug

Console-quality boss battles, 36 single player levels, multiplayer supported, tons of gear and unique avatars to collect!!

Solid single player mode
✓ Various enemies with rich AI
✓ Console-like smooth control
✓ 6 maps and 36 levels, loot can be used in solo and multiplayer modes

Simply the best co-op shooting game on smart phones
✓ Console-quality boss battles, team with up to 3 players(WIFI, 3G)
✓ Earn more gold in team survival mode.
✓ Armor and bags specially designed for team battle

Rich and flexible gear system
✓ 32 weapons, each upgradable 8 times, unlocked as you promote up the ranks.
✓ Nine Suits, each part with special attributes, a whole collection provides extra bonus. Elite suite entitles an extra special buff.
✓ Mix&match weapons with suits to earn additional damage
✓ 16 military bags with special functions

Source: The Game Website.

122818.name: Final Fury Pro
122818.description:
User Summary

Aliens have invaded and wiped out most of the world's armed forces. Into the breach step a pair of swashbuckling action heroes, armed to the teeth with a wide variety of uber-powerful weapons. In this third-person science-fiction shooter, you play one (or the other) of these characters, defeating waves of alien enemies across multiple post-apocalyptic levels.

The game features multiple upgrade options - both free and paid - including weapons, level-ups, ammo, and even costumes for your characters. Gameplay is extremely simple: shooting is automatic, so all you have to do is move your character to the right location and choose his/her weapons and special powers. But that doesn't mean the game is easy! As you advance in levels, the aliens become more powerful and more numerous.

122819.name: Hard Lines
122819.description:
Take on all comers, avoid collisions and score millions of points in this stunning game of skill and quick reflexes!

Guide our plucky underdog hero Lionel in his epic task to kill all lines, pick up lovely glowy things, fight for survival (in spaaaaaaace!) and most importantly don’t crash! This is literally the funniest game you will ever play that has a glowing yellow line as the main character.

Outwit the hilarious AI in a never-ending quest for points and glory on the worldwide leaderboards!

Aim to beat your personal best or compete against friend’s high scores over 6 distinctly fast, fun and frantic gameplay modes.

Inspired by classic arcade games from years gone by (you know the ones we’re talking about!), we’ve brought them kicking and screaming onto your mobile!

Screen-searing graphics, a bass-thumping retro soundtrack and endless replay value make this must-play package unlike anything else you’ve played.

Features

Hilarious Quips
Spiffy Leaderboards
Natty Game Center and OpenFeint integration
6 Lovely Game Modes
Crivens! Endless Replay Value




Source: The Game Website.

122820.name: Mistrz Słowa
122820.description:
This polish game can be simply described as 'Scrabble with dice'.
During his turn a player tries to compose a word from letters randomly generated on dice. The word has to be completed within a limited amount of time measured by an hourglass (approx. 1 minute). Points are then awarded according to the number of letters which constitute the word. The first player to gain a specified minimum amount of points is the winner.

122821.description:
Starmada is a miniatures board game of starship combat. At its most basic level, players take command of mighty fleets in a general attempt to reduce each other to just so much space junk. At its most advanced, the game can be customized to breathe life into any science fiction background that players might imagine.

The Nova Rulebook represents a new beginning for The Universal Game of Starship Combat. While in some ways this new edition is notably different from previous incarnations of the game, at its core Starmada remains the game players around the world have grown to know and love. As always, the guiding principle has been simple, but not simplistic. Within this book, players will find:

Streamlined inertial movement, with optional movement systems to encompass a wide range of settings;
An intuitive combat system, including three distinct and layered types of starship defenses; and
The most comprehensive set of starship construction rules available in any game currently available!

Dozens of stand-alone options and advanced rules are provided, from which you may pick and choose to fit your desired level of complexity and create the type of game YOU want to play.

Re-implements:

Starmada
Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
122821.name: Starmada Nova Rulebook

122822.name: Palomino Poker
122822.description:
Palomino is a casino-style table game with one dealer and up to seven players. The dealer's hand is always four cards or less, is never better than a pair, and is always completely face up. The player can buy up to five cards to try and beat the dealer, winning more money when the dealer's hand is better.

In addition to this Palomino board, which is available at the Cheapass website, you will need a deck of cards with one joker, and some poker chips.

Source: http://cheapass.com/freegames/palomino. Publisher's website.

122823.name: Boneyard
122823.description:
Boneyard is a silent-bid auction game in which players are bidding on buckets of money. The object is to be the first player to accumulate 40 dollars. Each player starts the game with 26 dollars.

This game is part of the Poker Suite compilation from CheapAss Games.

122824.name: Qube: Suomen kieli
122824.description: A simple and quickly played trivia game about the Finnish language. The game comprises cards with 500 questions in five different categories, such as dialects, slangs and funny synonyms. The game also includes 49 special cards. The game box is designed to be small enough to carry with you when traveling.

122825.name: Seven-Handed Poker
122825.description:
Seven-Handed Poker is a clever little way to play poker! This game requires a single deck of playing cards and seven poker chips.

In Seven-Handed Poker, players play any amount of cards from their hands. The player with the better poker hand wins the round. After each round, players always draw three cards regardless of how many cards they just played. Hand sizes will grow and shrink depending on how many cards a player plays each round.

122826.description:
Willow is a poker-like gambling game with a simpler hand structure. Each player has two cards. The best possible hand is a pair and other hands are ranked by the difference between the two cards: the greater the difference, the better the hand!

Willow uses a deck of 36 cards. Use a standard playing deck but remove the jokers, kings, and every card of a single suit.

Willow is part of the Poker Suite compilation by Cheapass Games.
122826.name: Willow

122827.name: Grimoirium Genitoris
122827.description:
"Grimoire of the Gods"

From the title page:

Within this grimoire are descriptions of immortals and religions. Regarding F.A.T.A.L., it is a collection, notarization, and study of metaphysical beings. Everything that MMs need to know in order to introduce gods to their games is included in this book. When possible, information concern- ing gods has been based on mythology, not whim.

User Summary:

Like every work but the main rulebook, this is unfinished.

122828.name: Talitaria
122828.description:
"Fantasy World for use with F.A.T.A.L."

User Summary:

An incomplete world design circulated from 2000 to 2002. The relationship with what became Neveria is unclear.

122830.name: Qube: Älä epäröi
122830.description: A fun and entertaining game well suited for social evenings. The game is about answering 10 questions in a fast pace without hesitation. Also, you may not answer yes or no, you may not cite the question, repeat an earlier answer or answer with a question. Be quick and guard your tongue! If you fail to abide by the aforementioned rules you fail and lose your turn. However, if you manage to answer all questions in a correct fashion you get to keep the question card. The players may agree upon how many cards are needed to win (and thus affect the playing time).

134191.name: Expedite: Limited Edition Word Trade Card Set

122831.description:
In the strategic route-building game Expedite, a player purchases hubs in different world cities in order to connect the starting and ending cities on one of his World Trade Cards. Don't own all the hubs? No problem – as long as you own the starting hub, you can give opponents points to use their hubs, but that might give them a greater share of the points from a World Trade Card than you get. Hmm, what to do?

To place a hub in an empty city, the player must discard 1-3 cards matching that city's color, with the number determined by the shape of the city. If someone else already has a hub in that city, you can pay double to place your hub on theirs; that player or another opponent can then pay triple to take possession; and so on.

On a turn, you either draw cards, place a hub (whether by discarding cards or playing a "free hub" card), or score a World Trade Card. The first player to collect 100 points wins.

Microbadge:
122831.name: Expedite

122832.name: Alfapet Razzle
122832.description:
A renewed and modern version of the classic word game Aflapet (also know as Scrabble). Create as many and as long words as you can in just one minute. The box includes a hourglass for keeping time and rules for three different versions of the game.

Alfapet Razzle on taas täällä – uudistettuna ja nykyaikaisena. Muodosta mahdollisimman monta ja pitkää sanaa yhden minuutin aikana. Kuutiossa on sisään rakennettu tiimalasi ajan ottamista varten. Pakkaus sisältää peliohjeet kolmeen hauskaan ja haastavaan pelivaihtoehtoon. Alfapet Razzle on Qube-perheen uusin jäsen. 2-6 pelaajalle, yli 10-vuotiaille Peliaika: Noin 30-60 minuuttia

122833.name: They're Off
122833.description:
Detailed statistical horse racing game. Each race takes a few dice rolls so you can play a campaign version if you want. That won't take more than a few evenings even if it a long campaign.

Board needs mounting (only a paper printed board provided), but worth the effort.

122835.name: Tropico 4: Modern Times
122835.description:
The times are changing and the island nation of Tropico is evolving. The Internet, a New World Order, terrorists, global financial markets and space exploration are on the rise and pose new challenges to El Presidente and his regime. Old buildings and structures are becoming obsolete and need to be upgraded or even replaced by their modern counterparts. Cars and transportation need modernization to meet the needs of a changing economy; and now El Presidente can even send people to the International Space Station! El Presidente and his ministers must now join the war against terror and control Internet regulation and freedom of speech on Tropico.

Source: The Publisher Website.

122836.name: Zeemote JS1 Mobile Gaming Controller
122836.description:
A simple truth: touchscreens are fine for dialing numbers and entering text, but they were never meant for advanced game playing. That’s where Zeemote wireless technology comes in.

With Zeemote, you instantly move from casual to serious gaming. Which means you can design mobile games with an entirely different level of functionality. Zeemote lets gamers get their fingers out of the way. It brings console-style gaming to the ever-growing world of mobile devices.

Why leave all the fun to those playing at home?

Source: The Developer Website.

122837.name: Sex Rated Charades
122837.description: As the title says, Charades with all the subjects being rude, the ruder the better. Obviously aimed at the older 'market'. The winner is the team who gets most correct.

122838.name: Goalmouth Scramble
122838.description:
A game for the committed statistical sport games collector - a statistical game of College Lacrosse. I think that it was an American game first played by native Americans but, here in England, it is always featured in 1950's girls' comics as being played at rather upmarket schools for girls.

As usual with this designer's games, a match is quickly resolved with a few dice rolls, so the keen Lacrosse fan can play a whole season of fixtures in a relatively short time.

122839.name: Goalspree!
122839.description:
An English football game but more linked to the business of football rather than playing football games.

The board has two tracks, the inner one for the first half of the game, where you build a team and a decent stadium to play in. Then, in the second half, you go round the outer track and hope to score as many goals as you can because goals are converted into cash.

Nice footballer playing pieces.

The most cash wins the game (which is sadly true in the 21st century British world of real football).

122840.name: Romance
122840.description:
American game exclusively aimed at females - in fact, specifically 2 to 6 women can play, according to the publishers.

Virtually all luck driven. Players go round the board, looking for Love, Available Men, Holidays and Romance. The player with the best collection of these ambitions, wins.

122841.name: Nightfall
122841.description:
User Summary

The Nightfall videogame is the iOS app of the popular deck-drafting game by AEG. Experience the card game via your apple device. Play against the computer or against up to 4 of your friends. The iOS app allows you to play multiple games simultaneously.

boardgamehonor.22668: 2013 UK Games Expo Best Boardgame Nominee

122842.description:
After a devastating nuclear war, six human factions are seeking shelter in the Centauri system. On the verge of extinction, the humans are saved by a superior civilization, allegedly the Centaurians, and each faction is given a fresh start on a new planet. Thus the exodus of humanity seems to have ended on the planets orbiting the star called Proxima Centauri. When the Centaurians announce their departure, the struggle for power commences once again.

In Exodus: Proxima Centauri, the six factions fight for dominance in an epic empire-building game, striving to build a new human empire on the ashes of the Centaurian civilization. Each player will build his own space fleet of customized ships and conquer new planets, fight the Centaurian Resistance and the other players, negotiate and vote for political decisions, research Centaurian technologies, and much more.
122842.name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri

122843.name: Disney's Mickey Saves the Day: 3D Adventure
122843.description:
User Summary

Disney's Mickey Saves the Day: 3D Adventure is a game published by Disney in 2001 for Windows. In the game the mayor of the town is gone and Pete takes over the mayor role, and starts abusing his new powers. The player can choose to either control Mickey or Minnie Mouse in a mouse-controlled Adventure game. The game also features many other Disney characters, like Goofy and Donald Duck.

122844.name: Mickey's Racing Adventure
122844.description:
From the back of the box:

Join Mickey in the racing adventure of a lifetime!

Explore 5 different adventure areas, such as Mickey's Home Town and Chip 'n Dale's Treehouse Glade. Visit Professor Von Drake to upgrade your car or boat with greater speed, handling or acceleration. Collect Mickey tokens to gain access to 5 different race worlds and over 20 courses, including a medieval castle, a pirate ship and a haunted mansion!

- Play as Mickey, Minnie, Donald, Daisy, Goofy AND Pluto!
- Test your puzzle-solving skills with the Train Game, Pete's Brain Strain and Pluto's Bone Hunt mini-games.
- Consult Magica de Spell for some supernatural help, such as Mickey's Magical Portal or Donald's Cloud of Frustration.
- Print out pictures using a Game Boy™ Printer (sold separately) and send messages you have won to a friend's Game Boy Color via the built-in Infra-red Communication Port.

122845.name: Legend of Illusion starring Mickey Mouse
122845.description:
User Summary:

Legend of Illusion starring Mickey Mouse is a game released for both the Game Gear and the Master System. The game is developed by Sega and released ion 1994/1995. This game is the fourth installment in the Illusion Series featuring Mickey Mouse. Similar to the other games in the series, this game features side-scrolling platform gameplay, in which Mickey has to save his kingdom, by traveling through various levels

122846.name: World of Illusion starring Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck
122846.description:
From the back of the box:

CAUTION: This Box Contains Amazing Magic. Take Home And Open Up For Instant Delight!

Alakazam! Here's classic Disney fun with your favorites, Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck! Transported into a world of wonder, Mickey and Donald must perform amazing feats of magic to defeat a crafty Sorcerer and find their way back home!

Poof! Mickey and Donald defeat evil foes with their enchanted cape as they voyage across the glorious skies on a magic carpet, journey through the gigantic forest and explore the ocean floor within a giant bubble.

And look - the gang's all here! Minnie Mouse, Daisy Duck, Goofy, Pluto, Clarabelle Cow, Huey, Duey and Louie all pop in to join the fun.

- Pursue the Sorcerer through 5 bedazzling levels of illusion.
- Mickey and Donald team up to brave dizzying chasms, dodge furious floods and explore bottomless mine shafts.
- Magical passwords let you pick up your game where you left off.

122847.name: Mickey Mouse
122847.description:
User Summary

Mickey Mouse is a game, developed and released by Kotobuki in 1989 for the Game Boy. It features Mickey Mouse who sets out on a quest to save Minnie Mouse, who has been captured by the evil villain. The gameplay consists of platforming action with puzzle elements, where the player needs to find a certain amount of hearts to exit a level.

This is the same game as
http://videogamegeek.com/videogame/81117/bugs-bunny-crazy-ca...

122848.name: Mickey's Space Adventure
122848.description:
Mickey's Space Adventure was a graphic adventure computer game for a number of computer platforms. It was created by Al Lowe and released by Sierra Entertainment in 1984. It features the Disney characters Mickey Mouse and Pluto.

The plot involved an alien race losing a precious crystal that contained all of their recorded history, which was split into nine pieces and hidden throughout Earth's solar system. While out walking Pluto, Mickey Mouse stumbles upon a spaceship sent by the aliens and is charged with searching the planets (and several moons) for the pieces of the crystal.

Written in 1984 by Roberta Williams, the game was a joint project with Disney prior to their collaboration on Black Cauldron. The game was intended for children. While there were several similar games featuring Disney characters, Mickey's Space Adventure is not considered part of a larger series. The PC version was on two 360 KB 5¼" disks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mickey's Space Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122849.name: Disney Sports: Skateboarding
122849.description:
Disney Sports Skateboarding, known as Disney All Star Sports: Skateboarding in Europe, is a 2002 sports video game released by Konami. The playable characters include Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, Goofy, Pete and Max Goof.

Source: Wikipedia, "Disney Sports Skateboarding," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122850.name: Investigator Weapons, Volume 1: The 1920s & 1930s
122850.description:
From the PDF:

Investigator Weapons for Call of Cthulhu in the Classic era is a comprehensive collection of weapons available to stalwart investigators of the Cthulhu Mythos and their crazed cultist opponents.

Investigator Weapons covers handguns, rifles, shotguns, submachine guns, machine guns, flamethrowers, melee weapons, explosives, and special ammunition; and gathers together all the spot rules for injury, environmental conditions, and firearms combat in one place, as well as introducing many optional rules for enhanced play.

Hans-Christian Vortisch (author of Cthulhu – Waffen-Handbuch, GURPS High-Tech, GURPS Martial Arts: Fairbairn Close Combat Systems, and GURPS Tactical Shooting) has selected several dozens of the most typical or iconic weapons available to the discerning shooter in the 1920s and 1930s. These range from the famous Colt M1911 and Thompson submachine gun to lesser known but more widespread firearms.

Each weapon is illustrated and described in detail, as are variant models. Significantly, each weapon’s operation is described, as are its typical malfunctions. Finishing each weapon description is the movie use of the weapon – so you can see it in action – and a comprehensive statistics bar.

Keepers are not forgotten either. Typical weapons for non-player characters are suggested, as are likely weapons for cultists from around the world. A Keeper’s chapter examines the consequences of magic on firearms and ammunition, and the effect of firearms on Mythos creatures.

Investigator Weapons – the essential weapons book for Keepers and players of all editions of Call of Cthulhu.

122851.name: Disney Sports: Soccer

videogamehonor.32598: 2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee

122851.description:
User Summary

Disney Sports Soccer is a game for GameCube and Game Boy Advance released in 2002. The game was developed and published by Konami as part of the Disney Sports Series.

The game features:
- Three modes of play,
- Player Customization,
- Special moves,
- Four player multiplayer splitscreen action (GameCube).
- Trading items between the Game Boy Advance and the GameCube version.

122852.name: Disney Sports: Basketball
122852.description:
User Summary:

Disney Sports Basketball is a basketball game developed and released by Konami as part of the Disney Sports Series. The game features 3 on 3 basketball gameplay, five different gameplay modes, multiplayer and many of the Disney characters. The game was released for both the GameCube and the Game Boy Advance. The GamCube version wasn't very well received, but the Game Boy Advance version got decent ratings.

122853.name: Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning – The Legend of Dead Kel
122853.description:
The legendary pirate Dead Kel and his Hanged Men have returned to haunt the seas of northern Amalur. Embark on a journey to the distant island of Gallows End with the eccentric Captain Brattigan in an adventure that will uncover a secret so great that it has incited wars and toppled kingdoms. Discover powerful new weapons and Twist of Fate Cards and use them to conquer the island's unique inhabitants. Become the Lord of Gravehal Keep and lay claim to this once great fort that stands upon the edge of a cliff in the most expansive player housing option yet. In an extensive new story and a host of new side quests, battle treacherous new enemies and face exciting new challenges on the mysterious island of Gallows End.

Source: The Publisher Website.

122854.name: Disney Sports: Snowboarding

videogameversion.161003: North American Game Boy Advance edition

122854.description:
User Summary:

Disney Sports Snowboarding is a Game Boy Advance game, developed and released by Konami in 2003, as part of the Disney Sports Series. The game consists of five stages, six snowboarders and many unlockable snowboards. Multiplayer is possible by linking multiple GBA systems.

122855.name: La ILSA Bonita
122855.description:
Two to four players are constructing the "ILSA Bonita" island, and must bid & purchase lots (with money) and build edifices (with workforce); every building gives money, workforce and victory points, but you must have the terrains with the correct shape. You can also gain an instant victory if you can build the Royal Palace!

This game is included in the the web-published italian magazine ILSA (issue #15). The download link is:
http://www.ilsa-magazine.it/project/ilsa-n-15/

122856.name: Disney Sports: Motocross
122856.description:
User Summary:

Disney Sports Motocross is a game developed and published by Konami as part of the Disney Sports Series. The game was released in 2003 and only for game Boy Advance. The game features six different courses and multiple modes. These modes include Championship, Time Trial, Training and multiplay up to four players by linking up multiple systems.

122857.name: Phineas and Ferb
122857.description:
Phineas and Ferb is an action platform video game published by Disney Interactive Studios about the animated television series of the same name for the Nintendo DS. The game was released in North America on February 3, 2009, while its United Kingdom release was on March 23. The Australian release came later on September 23, 2009. The game is the first Phineas and Ferb video game and the first to be released for the DS.

The game's basic plot is similar to the show, as the player controls Phineas Flynn and his stepbrother Ferb Fletcher as they take part in several schemes and adventures for their summer vacation. The two as well attempt to avoid their sister Candace, who is persistent in trying to "bust" them. Mini games are scattered throughout the game, building up the side foundation.

Source: Wikipedia, "Phineas and Ferb (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122858.name: Schweizer Sammelsurium
122858.description:
Humorous quiz game about Switzerland.
Goal of the game is to reach last station first. You can advance through luck of the dice, correct answers, real wealth, misleading other players and ignorance of the other players.
Players roll the dice and if arrow is rolled he moves up the ladder. If "K", "S" or "W" is rolled player takes a creative, estimate or knowledge card from the deck and asks a question. There is a short game and a team option.

122859.name: Disney Sports: Football

videogameversion.161014: North American Game Boy Advance edition

122859.description:
User summary:

Disney Sports Football is a game develope and published by Konami, as part of the Disney Sports Series. The game was released for both the GameCube and the Game Boy Advance. The GameCuber version supports up to four player splitscreen multiplayer, but the GBA version has no multiplayer mode. The game features several game modes, 14 special 'Magic' moves, five teams and Disney characters like Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Goofy, Pete and others.

122861.name: Kitten Cannon
122861.description:
User Summary

The goal is to launch the kitten as far as possible.
Adjust the trajectory of the cannon, and try to hit the power meter at it's height. There are objects in the game which help or hinder the distance the kitten travels. For example spikes impale the kitten which stop it, and a trampoline or explosives give it additional bounce.

Not rated but includes violent images.

122862.name: Dexterity
122862.description:
User Summary

Capture orange (200 pts) and green (100 pts) orbs to score points while avoiding spikes, which end the game if hit.
Game is played on one screen, orbs spikes and your character move.

122863.name: Deadly Dwarves
122863.description:
User Summary

Static first person shooting game in which you try to kill the Elves and kittens before they kill you. Hit the UFO's for machine gun fire, the first aid kit to refill health and the Ammo Dwarves for additional ammo. Bonus points for reaching 5, 10, 20, 30, 40 or 50 hits in a row.

122864.name: Turok: Evolution (GBA)

videogameversion.161022: North American Game Boy Advance edition

122864.description:
From the back of the box:

The Dinosaur Hunter Returns!


Join the war raging in the Lost Lands against Lord Tyrannus and his army of Dinosoids.
Strap on over 15 weapons for an adventure over jungles, military trains, rivers and fortresses.
Light up the skies with rocket launchers and flame throwers.
Link up with a friend for 2-player cooperative squad action.


YOU ARE TUROK!

122865.name: Northwest Passage
122865.description:
user summary

An adventure for Cyberpunk 2020 set in the frozen north.

It is designed for 3-6 players and focuses on corporate intrigue and survival.

122866.name: Spank the Monkey
122866.description:
User Summary

Drag the cursor across the screen as quickly as you can.

122867.name: Four Taverns
122867.description:
In Four Taverns, everyone is competing to have the best tavern in the land. And how do you measure success for a tavern? Customers. No, wait – awesome customers who have done great things that inspire others to come drink with them and your tavern. Thus, you're going to support adventurers on their quests to do great things, which will ideally bring renown upon you and your tavern in the end.

In game terms, each player starts with a hand of adventurers and some coins. Two or three quests are laid out face-up, and each quest shows the strength of the adventurer party – in terms of warrior, wizard, cleric and rogue – required to complete the quest. On a turn, you draw two adventurers cards, then play any number of cards (including zero) – paying their costs at the same time – in order to complete quests and gain the income and renown associated with it. When a quest is completed, all other adventurer cards are discarded.

Why not just hold adventurers in hand until you can send out a massive party all at once? Your tavern is tiny at the start of the game, so you need to keep sending out adventurers in order to make room for more. As you gain renown, though, you'll increase the size of your tavern and have room to hold more adventurers in wait. Champions are special adventurers who fulfill two roles at once, and special action cards bring spice to the game play.

The first player to collect twenty renown wins.

122868.name: Blackrock City
122868.description:
In Blackrock City, you are the chief of your group of outlaws, and you want to claim as much gold and silver as possible by attacking cities and stagecoaches. You will have to be clever to estimate the number of outlaws needed to attack – and watch out for the Sheriff and your opponents!

The game is played in rounds. Each round, players bid on the right to perform the next bank robbery by placing a number of outlaws in the center of the playing area; each player starts with eight outlaws. Alternatively a player can skip the round or postpone an attack until after other players bid, but doing so will cause one or more of his outlaws to become wounded. When a player bids outlaws, the sheriff token moves a number of city tiles equal to the number of outlaws bid (in most cases). If a sheriff lands on a player's Chief of the Outlaws token – as these tokens are located on city tiles and not used for bidding – one of that player's outlaws is wounded.

The winner of the bid attacks a city, most likely netting him gold and possibly giving him new outlaws (as they are freed from that city's prison), but which city is attacked is determined by the difference between the winning bid and the lowest bid. Thus, bids from the other players will influence the winner's gains – and if the winner lands on the city tile where the sheriff is located, he gets nothing. The player with the second highest bid attacks the stagecoach and gains one silver.

If a player claims something from a city tile, it's flipped over and now has a different power for the remainder of the game, allowing a player who lands on the tile to steal gold or silver cubes from an opponent or wounding one of that player's outlaws. After each round, players collect the outlaws they used to bid and "wound" the healthy outlaws by flipping them over to their wounded side. A wounded outlaw who is wounded again is removed from the game. (Prisoners come into the game wounded, so they can be used only once.)

The game ends when no player has any outlaws remaining or all players refuse to bid in a given round. The player who has collected the most gold and silver wins!

122871.name: View From the Edge: The Cyberpunk Handbook
122871.description: Comprehensive players' guide to roles, mechanics, and cybernetic interface for Cyberpunk 2013.

122872.name: Welcome to Night City: A Sourcebook for 2013
122872.description:
From back cover of book:

Cyberpunk: the original roleplaying game of the dark future; a world of corporate assasins, heavy-metal heroes and brain burning cyberhackers, packed with cutting edge technology and intense urban action.

122873.name: Cartes sur Table
122873.description:
Cartes sur table (French idiom for "Lay cards on the table") is a light party game where you get to find what "habits" match each player.

The game plays in 4 rounds. Each round has 2 phases.

1- Each player receives as many habit cards as there are players around the table. E.g.: 4 cards for 4 players. "You are always late", "You cheat at games", "You have the same Pink Floyd t-shirt since 1994".
Each player give to OTHER players the card of his hand that fits him best. Therefore, in a 4 player game, you give 3 cards (and receive 3). The last one is discarded.

2- In turns, each player reveals the cards he has received. All players (including the "concerned" one) secretly vote for the best matching habit. Players who voted for the most popular score one point. The chosen card is then kept by the player for the fourth round.
NOTE: The vote from the concerned player count as 1 vote only. He does not choose the habit alone, but he breaks ties.

On the fourth round, instead of distributing new habit cards, players skip the first phase and use the cards selected in the 3 first rounds. Each good vote is worth 2 points for this last round.

Player with the most point wins.

122874.description:
Hedron Flare is a promo card that will be given out to players that show up to game day locations and will likely be made available for sale on the Ascension website at a later date.

From the Card:

Hedron Flare
Cost: 6 Runes to acquire
Mechana Construct
Once per turn, you may acquire a Mechana Hero in the center row without paying it's cost.
122874.name: Ascension: Storm of Souls – Hedron Flare Promo

122875.name: Friday Night Firefight
122875.description:
From Introduction:

"Friday Night Firefight is a weapons system for using modern, futuristic and archaic firearms in roleplaying adventures. It is designed to cover all elements of firearms combat in an easy to use format, allowing realistic firefight action without resorting to numerous tables and charts. FNFF also covers elements of melee weapons and hand-to-hand combat as well."

Designed as an advanced combat engine for the Interlock system.

122876.name: Altered Beast: Guardian of the Realms
122876.description:
User Summary

Altered Beast: Guardian of the Realms is a Game Boy Advance exclusive and a sequel to Sega's classic Altered Beast. The game borrows its feel from Castlevania titles on the Game Boy Advance, but preserves the storytelling method of the original Altered Beast. Once again, Zeus summons you from your grave to combat the forces of evil, which you do with several weapons and with the ability to morph into a variety of powerful beasts.

122877.description:
Conquest of Planet Earth: Apocalypse, an expansion for ''Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game'', includes new alien races (one of them being the Martian Confederation from FFP's ''Invasion from Outer Space''), new allies to help those invaders, and new cards for all other decks in the base game. The expansion includes a new "Coastal Resistance Deck" that boosts Earth's defense forces with naval ships, submarines, and jet fighters.

Additional components allow for two additional players to join in, raising the maximum player count to six.
122877.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: Apocalypse

71882.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game

122878.description:
Last Night on Earth: Blood in the Forest sees the human heroes – fleeing, as always, from approaching hordes of zombies – fight their way deeper into the forested mountains.

This expansion, which can be added to Last Night on Earth: Timber Peak or the original Last Night on Earth board game, features new forest game boards (four corners and four straight pieces), a new double-sided forest center board (with the Airfield), two new types of zombie figures – a pack of vicious feral zombies and the menacing zombie behemoths – to hunt down the heroes, two new heroes (Sister Ophelia, the reformed nun, and Agent Carter, an FBI agent who knows more about the outbreak than he lets on), as well as a host of new hero and zombie cards, counters, scenarios, and game mechanisms. Last Night on Earth: Blood in the Forest also expands on the Experience system originally introduced in LNOE: Timber Peak. As the zombie plague spreads, the forests will run red!
